highlightedJobListings.description:
Software Development Mentor/Instructor @ IOSD

We are looking for people who want to really effect critical change to education in India.
We, at IOSD, are looking to hire charismatic instructors who can teach software development to students. The students belong to universities/colleges across India.
Students will enroll in our online courses to gain valuable technical and professional skills needed to take them from curious learners to employed software developers.

If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by doing what you know and love, this is the position for you. Through this unparalleled opportunity, you will: 
•	Deepen your own development skills by guiding students through a rigorous journey where they begin as driven novices and leave as empowered developers 
•	Help students achieve their full academic potential
•	Facilitate a supportive and energetic community that lasts well beyond the course 

Who you are 
•	Passionate and experienced developer 
•	Clear and engaging speaker 
•	Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience a plus

What you'll get 
•	From beginner to expert, you’ll learn how to be an effective online instructor. 
•	Competitive compensation (see details below) 
•	Opportunity for growth 
•	Unmatched teaching experience with plenty of student feedback 
•	Expand your reach with access to students across the globe 


Compensation
We offer competitive compensation package : Base pay + % revenue share, commensurate with experience  

Benefits
Flexible Schedule 
Autonomy
Develop your skills alongside other like-minded instructors
Expand your reach 
Unlimited class sizes, and not just for one semester
We’ll get your courses in front of the right audience
Expand your reach and teaching portfolio
Continuous Pay 


We’re driven by a big mission
Our team is phenomenal, and we look out for each other. We genuinely care about your personal and professional growth.
You'll work closely with the founders, and help set strategy and direction.

Get in early and get the best options for course exclusivity. These are the courses that have the greatest potential earnings and the opportunity to reach the most students. We have a limited number of course contracts available, and each course contract is exclusively signed to one instructor. We build foundational relationships to last, and the earlier you start, the better.

Please fill the form to apply:
https://forms.gle/9G5FTLKKp1TqWTZ78

highlightedJobListings.description:
Only applications submitted via https://jobs.lever.co/roger/2346bedd-138d-4755-b73e-6c64903c4b0c will be considered

Remote candidates encouraged - we have a remote-first culture. 

About Us

Roger was founded to make day-to-day financial operations like bill pay, expense management, compliance and bookkeeping as worry-free as possible for business owners, finance teams, accountants and bookkeepers. Roger works as an automated layer on top of a company's accounting software, saving businesses and accountants hours of work every day. We're proud of the product that we've built so far, and our 1,000+ global customers base agree that we're making something complex and tedious simple and maybe even fun. 

We are backed by some of the best investors in the financial technology and just raised $7.3m. We have huge ambitions for our growth in 2019. But we are still a small team and therefore we want you to be part of the journey.
Joining Roger will be chance to join a fast-paced company, with a global product. We hire for attitude and not credentials. Please apply regardless of your current position background, or experience.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Engineer to run our integration efforts with our services. Our product integrates with a number of different services, such as accounting platforms like QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, as well as collaboration tools like Slack, Box and Dropbox. Allowing our customers to set up custom workflows that fit their exact needs is a core part of our product experience. We have an existing integration framework and a robust API in place, but we are looking to add a new team member to own the integration work end-to-end. This includes building new, as well as maintaining and improving the existing ones - all to ensure a stellar user experience.

You'll be working collaboratively with the rest of the engineering team as well as with the product team to drive the implementation and release of new integrations. You'll be familiar with all parts of our stack from end to end, and will drive positive change to Roger's engineering culture, processes and technology.

We see this role as a unique chance to own an important piece of the Roger product, see it grow, and flourish very quickly. 

Your profile

- Excited to work on building the foundations of Roger's integrations ecosystem
- Comfortable working with external partners and managing your projects from A-Z
- Experience in working with object-oriented programming
- Comfortable working with .NET and C#
- Experience working with relational\non-relational, Aurora\MySql and Dynamodb
- Experience with REST APIs

The Team

The engineering team is characterized by a high degree of support internally. We help each other out and pitch in when problems arise as well as give each other feedback to grow. Our top priority is to build the world's best financial automation platforms, while keeping our users safe and compliant. Scalability, reliability and robustness are keywords we live by but we also get excited about building out feature MVPs quickly to keep our innovative reputation with customers and partners alive and well at all times.   

The Stack

Roger's backend is built on .NET with C#. We love the simplicity, speed and structure of C#, combined with the built-in security and robustness it offers developers. On the front-end we work in React and React Native, enabling us to build reliable web experiences that can handle high usage volumes. 

Additionally, we make extensive use of Lamda (integrations only), AWS, Git, Bugsnag, Heroku and other great tools to keep our development processes running smoothly. 

Our Values

We're a global company with offices in Copenhagen and San Francisco. Our values are heavily influenced by our Scandinavian roots (both founders are from Denmark), and count humility, humor and inclusiveness. We strive to create a culture where anyone feels part of the family, and we place a great amount of value in hiring for attitude rather than resumes. We support flexibility in everyone's lives, and working at Roger can be easily combined with babies, toddlers and teenagers. We have two primary office locations but have a remote culture that we put a lot of effort into as we believe great talent can be found anywhere. As a remote worker you can be sure to feel like you are as much part of the team as those who come to an office every day. About every 6 months we all get together in person. Our last trips took us to Greece and Spain. Everyone on the team shares a passion for creating the best possible product and user experience, and that is something we value in future team members as well. 

The Roger Story

Roger's founders started the company after exiting their first startup to Cisco Systems. Having experienced all the frustrations with daily financial operations when starting previous ventures, the first gist of an idea for Roger was born in 2016. Since then, international investors from both Europe and the US have supported the growth of the team and the customer base, and the product is now used and loved by more than 1,000 customers worldwide. 

Roger is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

- Create a controller "AgentyJobApplication"
- Use a NoSQL database. For example Litedb (free), MongoDB (free trial in Atlas), Dynamo DB (Free trial in AWS) or any other of your choice.
- Create a class "MyResume" with properties {name, email, phone, location, skills [], experience}
- Insert the class object document to your NoSQL database
- POST : Create a HTTP POST action to add your resume and return the :id with Status: 200
- GET : Show your resume by id
- Host your project on Github public repository(Free)

The role includes working on projects with international brands as well as medium to large sized clients. The successful applicant will collaborate closely with our technical project manager at Vivid Unity and Behind The Chain as well as our global team across the company.

The role includes working on some very cool AR games as well as wallet and chat technologies. The successful applicant will collaborate closely with our designers and creatives as well as our key team across the company.

highlightedJobListings.description:
** TO APPLY CLICK ON THE FOLLOWING LINK 
https://www.welcometothejungle.co/companies/forest-admin/jobs/developer-evangelist_paris
TO APPLY CLICK ON THE LINK ABOVE **

**About** 
Forest Admin has been designed to help developers save time and to provide business teams with a tool tailored to their operations, at scale. At Forest Admin, we’ve developed an "admin panel as a service" allowing any web-based company to skip all the design, development and maintenance of their back office.

Technically speaking, Forest Admin is an open-source plugin which analyses your data models and automatically generate an admin API on which business teams can work on. Building such tool required us to re-think the entire architecture of our product where we would never access our client’s data, introducing a new class of product in the SaaS world.

How big is it? All apps need a back office, which means we have an impact on virtually … all web related businesses! We’re currently on-boarding more and more fast-growing companies (ex. Qonto, Heetch, Carbon Health…) at an incredible pace and we want to accelerate our expansion.

Why you should apply? https://medium.com/into-the-forest/hiring-is-a-two-way-street-4b3361ae5138
Learn more about our culture: https://medium.com/into-the-forest/the-lumberjacks-code-of-honor-33e71cc77258

**What you will do** 
Your main challenge as Forest Admin's Developer Advocate is to create, educate and grow a developer community with an open source mindset that is passionate about web apps and sharing knowledge about admin development best practices and tools.

As a modern-day Forest ranger your will be in charge of spreading the word in the tech community about Forest Admin.

Milestone 1

*Gain a deep understanding of Forest Admin’s product
* Build relationships with key members of Forest's Developer Community
* Prepare a list of technical topics of interest to our Community

Milestone 2

* Initiate a blog/screencast series for our Community
* Propose new programs to improve the developer experience, grow the community, and increase engagement (web agencies, schools, associations & groups, labs, incubators, etc.)

Milestone 3

* Scale the blog/screencast series
* Kick off new programs, track results, and adjust as necessary
* Speak and perform your first demo at an event (meetups, webinars, etc.)

Milestone 4

* Produce regular technical content that shows developers how to use Forest * Admin and get the most out of our premium features.
* Share your admin panel development expertise by giving talks, conducting workshops and attending developer events.
* Provide support and guidance to developers within our online community channels including Discourse, Github, Twitter, Stack Overflow and other spaces.
* Connect with other developers, developer advocates, educators, entrepreneurs and accelerators to find opportunities to integrate Forest Admin into technical programs and curriculums.

**Skills we are looking for** 
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English
* Relevant software engineering experience including full-stack expertise. You should feel very comfortable implementing Forest Admin across different stacks and helping debug implementation issues.
* Experience growing a community.
* Experience writing technical content or explaining technical concepts in blog posts, forums, emails, webcasts, infographics or other channels.

NICE TO HAVE
* Regularly active on open-source projects.
* Familiar with SaaS business fundamentals.

**Why you should apply** 
* Take part in a project firmly rooted in the 'Tools for Developers' space
* Opportunity to educate on a new class of SaaS products
* Commitment to Open Source development philosophy
* Opportunity to join the core team of a fast paced startup 
* Competitive salary 
* Equity 
* Strong company values and team ethos 
* Cool offices located in the Silicon Sentier (75010, Paris) 
* Great team events

**Recruitment process** 
* Preliminary call 
* Fit interview with our CEO 
* Case study 
* Feedback and challenge meeting with our CEO

Who we are:
MindMate is a fast-growing, fully funded start-up at the intersection of technology and healthcare. We’re a team of business & health experts, mobile & web engineers, and we work with a long list of clinical research organizations. Through our combined expertise and passion, we strive every day to deliver great products that empower the baby boomer generation.

What we do:
MindMate is the leading app for the baby boomer generation that is helping our target audience to manage their health condition(s) better and start a healthier lifestyle through mental exercises, brain exercises, advice around proper nutrition and activities around reminiscence. We are a very dynamic team with a unique dedication to delivering excellent products and user experiences, implemented through ground-breaking technology.
Our customers are small to large research organizations (pharmaceutical companies, CROs, Universities) who recognise that mobile technology can enhance their patient recruitment and patient retention process for their clinical studies.
People love what we do. And now we need you to continue developing awesome features for our users.
What you will do
• You will collaborate with UX designers to iterate on the design and implementation of our product
• You will work with our data scientists and backend engineers to build and ship features
• You will build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions
• You will find and address performance issues
• You will participate in design and code reviews
• You will identify and communicate front-end best practices
What we are looking for
• You have a strong knowledge of JavaScript
• You have experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling
• You have some back-end experience, using Node.JS
• You are familiar with server-side MVC web frameworks, such as Django or Ruby on Rails • You have a strong knowledge of commanding grasp of HTML, CSS and related web
technologies
• You have strong computer science fundamentals
• You have an awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance
considerations

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for technology and a desire to be part of a fast growing start up.

With 20 years in IT, Bharja Technologies offers services to streamline IT strategies, information security assurance and system integration, ensure smooth and effective digital transformation and improve digital customer experience.

At Bharja Technologies, we develop and deploy platform agnostic, high-performance cloud applications, customized to your specific business needs. We provide client-centric mobility solutions that are inline with the business goals for SMEs and corporates.

Bharja Technologies takes great pride in delivering web application services and best-in-class website development services with compelling functionality to create a long-lasting impression both visually and interactively.

Bharja Technologies offers enhanced performance for managing business processes, data, and remote infrastructure. Our expertise lies in delivering quality consulting, implementation, and integration of strategic business processes. We design, create and deploy flexible engagement models for custom based requirements.

Driven by 20 years of experience in software testing and QA services, Bharja Technologies offers comprehensive product audit from different angles, including code quality, solution functionality, usability, performance and security.

At Bharja Technologies, we develop, publish, measure and optimize content across social platforms for our clients whether it be a simple campaign to drive festival sales or a complex campaign engagement to increase consumer generated content, which can then be rechanneled into the brand content funnel.

The successful candidates would have a desire to learn, self-educate and operate very independently; having vision, direction and be willing to take ownership.

In return, we'll offer:

• An opportunity to work on a technically advanced project with a young and vibrant team.

highlightedJobListings.description:
We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform that enables product designers and engineers to get instant quotes and instantly order custom parts – Similar to Amazon but for custom manufacturing! In less than 6 months we have grown to supply customers from Startups to FTSE 100 companies, including parts for space missions!


We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on growth, learning and problem solving.You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business.


When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 27 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks. Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace.


Who are we looking for?


We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer with research mindset, having experience with computational geometry, complex algorithm development, and programming in C++. If you want to be part or lead this team, we would love to hear from you.


Key skills;


- Minimum Master of Science degree in Applied mathematics, Physics or Computer Science  – Experience with Computational Geometry, Linear Algebra, Topology concepts, Representations and data structures (such as NURBS, Splines, Level sets, Surface and Volumetric meshes, Analytical surfaces/Solids,Functional representations) – Strong experience with C++, Object Oriented Programming, Data Structures and Algorithms – Excellent oral and written communication skills – Self-motivated individual with exceptional problem solving skills and work ethic – Desire to learn and work or lead in a small, multi-national, innovative and creative team


Additional Desirable Experience within any of the below;


- Knowledge of modelling kernels such as Parasolid – Knowledge of CAD/CAM – Experience with source code repositories such as GIT, SVN Familiarity with agile development methods


If you are, 
1. open to an exciting challenge, 2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and 3. believe you have what it takes – apply now!


Full time salary circa £25-40k + Share Options and opportunity to manage/lead products and teams 


Other Benefits


• Free in-office 3D printing! • An extra day off for your birthday • Generous Holiday • A sociable team with weekly office events • Prime location on the edge of Shoreditch• We get to work with the most innovative designers and companies every single day!

highlightedJobListings.description:
Merchbar’s Engineers are the backbone of Merchbar and each have a personal, direct impact on a product that supports hundreds of thousands of artists and reaches many millions of fans.

Our organization is small and individual roles are deep - all of our engineers contribute across the entire stack and develop through all stages of development from scoping and architecture to implementation, scaling and optimization. 

Here’s a preview of the work you’d do in this role at Merchbar

- Collaborate with engineers and others in all phases of development from concept to launch
- Ship customer-facing storefront features to millions of users
- Extend and improve the integrations that connect us to hundreds of external merchandise systems, keeping our inventory fresh and orders on track
- Use image recognition to improve our product classifications
- Create new data models and update our PostgreSQL schema. Write efficient, optimized SQL queries
- Brainstorm and implement a series of A/B tests to improve our checkout flow
- Build internal tools and automations that empower your non-technical coworkers
- Help improve our software development process and engineering best practices as our team continues to grow

Here is what we’re looking for in you

- 3+ years of professional full-stack web application engineering experience in a language such as Python, Java, Ruby, C++, etc., including experience with SQL database modeling and HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
- Experience/comfort working with 3rd Party APIs
- A continual desire to learn. Experience with our technology stack is not required (Node, Bootstrap, Python, Flask, Celery, Postgres, etc.), but the possibility of learning a new framework is exciting to you
- Great communication skills. You can effectively talk (and listen) to engineers, designers, and support team members
- Fluency with data, including the ability to choose the right metrics and use basic probability and statistics to guide decision-making and prove ideas right or wrong
- Creative, flexible, and resourceful problem-solving skills. In an environment where time and resources are always limited, you realize the perfect solution is not always the right one.
- An eagerness to help your coworkers. When things break, you’re ready to jump in and help.

What we offer

- Competitive Salary and Equity
- Healthcare
- Flexible vacation policy
- Professional/Career Development

highlightedJobListings.description:
Looking for a job where you’ll gain significant equity while having a huge impact on product innovation? Lootcakes is a small but fast-growing games data and marketing venture that already counts some of the world’s top game publishers as clients. The Lootcakes team has deep experience in games and ad tech, with multiple exits under our belt.

Our mission is to empower gamers to harness their data. We’ve created an innovative way to help both players and publishers of mobile and PC games, with data at the heart of the equation. On our B2C side, we reward players for sharing their valuable-as-gold game purchase data. On our B2B side, we leverage our data to help publishers acquire high-value players. 

We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer to scale our network, build mission-critical products, and unleash the power of our data. You will be a senior and foundational member of our technology team, working directly with the co-founders and COO.  We’re a distributed team across NYC, Seattle, and Denver and you can work from any location in the US. 

You might be a fit if you:
●	Are self-motivated and driven to learn and implement new technologies
●	Enjoy a fast-paced, entrepreneurial culture
●	Have deep, well-balanced skills (front-end, back-end, database, DevOps)
●	Embrace agile/lean development methodologies
●	Communicate well with product and business team members
●	Love games!

What you would do:
●	Build the next generation of our mobile-optimized B2C platform
●	Deploy machine learning to fully leverage our valuable user data
●	Help architect and build our first mobile app and our first B2B site
●	Scale our service to handle millions of users
●	Build internal tools for business operations, data viz and analytics
●	Develop and integrate advertising technology
●	Securely manage sensitive data
●	Help build our tech team

Qualifications:
●	5+ years of experience 
●	Experience with B2C web/mobile
●	Experience balancing growth (e.g. conversion optimization) alongside  medium to longer-term development initiatives
●	Experience deploying ML libraries/algorithms a big plus
●	Must be proficient in the following skills/languages:
   	○	.NET (C#, MVC)
	  ○	Front-end (CSS, js/jQuery)
	  ○	T-SQL
	  ○	Database design/management
	  ○	Azure (or AWS)/Windows Server Management
●	Experience with the following platforms/tools a plus: Advertising technology, Google Analytics, ServiceStack, Hangfire, Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, Redgate SQL Change Automation, and Team Foundation Server
●	We only consider candidates authorized to work in the US and fluent in English.
●	We will not consider contractors working for software development outsourcing companies to fill the needs of this role. If you fit that description, please do not inquire.

What we offer:
●	Competitive salary and significant equity in a fast-growing company
●	100% paid health, dental, and vision insurance
●	Healthcare FSA, Short-term Disability, Life Insurance, AD&D, One Medical
●	Paid vacation and sick days
●	Work from home

We’re passionate about building one of the great games industry growth stories of the next decade. If you’re interested to join a fast-paced venture just as things are really taking off, send us your resume and feel free to include a cover letter.

highlightedJobListings.description:
We’re FarApp, a rapidly growing e-commerce automation solution company. It sounds like a lot of buzz words, but we really are growing fast and want to bring in new talented folks to help manage our rapidly expanding customer base. We hope that we can find that talent in you!

FarApp is a SAAS company who has been in business for over 15 years. In those 15 years we’ve expanded our original codebase to over 1.5 million lines of code processing millions of operations a day. We connect to over 60 endpoints to help our customers become versatile e-commerce participants.  

What will you be doing?

You’ll be diving into our code and figuring out ways to permanently solve problems that our customers either create or point out. This requires that you have a comfort with reading code in the context of a larger system without fear and that you're willing to try out and test solutions. You need to be comfortable deploying code 10 times a day into a live environment as you solve real-world problems. 

You’ll also be helping to expand our product line. We add new endpoints to our service all the time, meaning that we must develop new connectors to integrate within our current system. That could mean something simple like a new logistics company, or it could be a new marketplace that has popped up that people are flocking to. 

You’ll also be participating in our continuing effort to reduce our integration time. Currently, we have an average integration time for new customers of 40 days. We strongly believe we can reduce that to less than a day, maybe less than a couple of hours. We need your creative, intelligent ideas and initiative to make that happen. 

We're looking for somebody who is passionate about software and is interested to start at the ground-level with a company so that they can help it grow and share in its success. We hope that you're excited to make a big impact because you'll have plenty of opportunities to do that. We don't need somebody with a lot of experience but just need somebody who can learn new technologies quickly and is excited to make learning part of their regular routine.

Cool things:
Competitive salary with great benefits
Working from home!  
We offer health, dental and vision plans.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Merchbar’s Engineers are the backbone of Merchbar and each have a personal, direct impact on a product that supports hundreds of thousands of artists and reaches many millions of fans.

Our organization is small and individual roles are deep - all of our engineers contribute across the entire stack and develop through all stages of development from scoping and architecture to implementation, scaling and optimization. 

Here’s a preview of the work you’d do in this role at Merchbar

- Collaborate with engineers and others in all phases of development from concept to launch
- Ship customer-facing storefront features to millions of users
- Extend and improve the integrations that connect us to hundreds of external merchandise systems, keeping our inventory fresh and orders on track
- Use image recognition to improve our product classifications
- Create new data models and update our PostgreSQL schema. Write efficient, optimized SQL queries
- Brainstorm and implement a series of A/B tests to improve our checkout flow
- Build internal tools and automations that empower your non-technical coworkers
- Help improve our software development process and engineering best practices as our team continues to grow

Here is what we’re looking for in you

- 3+ years of professional full-stack web application engineering experience in a language such as Python, Java, Ruby, C++, etc., including experience with SQL database modeling and HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
- Experience/comfort working with 3rd Party APIs
- A continual desire to learn. Experience with our technology stack is not required (Node, Bootstrap, Python, Flask, Celery, Postgres, etc.), but the possibility of learning a new framework is exciting to you
- Great communication skills. You can effectively talk (and listen) to engineers, designers, and support team members
- Fluency with data, including the ability to choose the right metrics and use basic probability and statistics to guide decision-making and prove ideas right or wrong
- Creative, flexible, and resourceful problem-solving skills. In an environment where time and resources are always limited, you realize the perfect solution is not always the right one.
- An eagerness to help your coworkers. When things break, you’re ready to jump in and help.

What we offer

- Competitive Salary and Equity
- Healthcare
- Flexible vacation policy
- Professional/Career Development

highlightedJobListings.description:
Only applications submitted via https://jobs.lever.co/roger/2346bedd-138d-4755-b73e-6c64903c4b0c will be considered

Remote candidates encouraged - we have a remote-first culture. 

About Us

Roger was founded to make day-to-day financial operations like bill pay, expense management, compliance and bookkeeping as worry-free as possible for business owners, finance teams, accountants and bookkeepers. Roger works as an automated layer on top of a company's accounting software, saving businesses and accountants hours of work every day. We're proud of the product that we've built so far, and our 1,000+ global customers base agree that we're making something complex and tedious simple and maybe even fun. 

We are backed by some of the best investors in the financial technology and just raised $7.3m. We have huge ambitions for our growth in 2019. But we are still a small team and therefore we want you to be part of the journey.
Joining Roger will be chance to join a fast-paced company, with a global product. We hire for attitude and not credentials. Please apply regardless of your current position background, or experience.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Engineer to run our integration efforts with our services. Our product integrates with a number of different services, such as accounting platforms like QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, as well as collaboration tools like Slack, Box and Dropbox. Allowing our customers to set up custom workflows that fit their exact needs is a core part of our product experience. We have an existing integration framework and a robust API in place, but we are looking to add a new team member to own the integration work end-to-end. This includes building new, as well as maintaining and improving the existing ones - all to ensure a stellar user experience.

You'll be working collaboratively with the rest of the engineering team as well as with the product team to drive the implementation and release of new integrations. You'll be familiar with all parts of our stack from end to end, and will drive positive change to Roger's engineering culture, processes and technology.

We see this role as a unique chance to own an important piece of the Roger product, see it grow, and flourish very quickly. 

Your profile

- Excited to work on building the foundations of Roger's integrations ecosystem
- Comfortable working with external partners and managing your projects from A-Z
- Experience in working with object-oriented programming
- Comfortable working with .NET and C#
- Experience working with relational\non-relational, Aurora\MySql and Dynamodb
- Experience with REST APIs

The Team

The engineering team is characterized by a high degree of support internally. We help each other out and pitch in when problems arise as well as give each other feedback to grow. Our top priority is to build the world's best financial automation platforms, while keeping our users safe and compliant. Scalability, reliability and robustness are keywords we live by but we also get excited about building out feature MVPs quickly to keep our innovative reputation with customers and partners alive and well at all times.   

The Stack

Roger's backend is built on .NET with C#. We love the simplicity, speed and structure of C#, combined with the built-in security and robustness it offers developers. On the front-end we work in React and React Native, enabling us to build reliable web experiences that can handle high usage volumes. 

Additionally, we make extensive use of Lamda (integrations only), AWS, Git, Bugsnag, Heroku and other great tools to keep our development processes running smoothly. 

Our Values

We're a global company with offices in Copenhagen and San Francisco. Our values are heavily influenced by our Scandinavian roots (both founders are from Denmark), and count humility, humor and inclusiveness. We strive to create a culture where anyone feels part of the family, and we place a great amount of value in hiring for attitude rather than resumes. We support flexibility in everyone's lives, and working at Roger can be easily combined with babies, toddlers and teenagers. We have two primary office locations but have a remote culture that we put a lot of effort into as we believe great talent can be found anywhere. As a remote worker you can be sure to feel like you are as much part of the team as those who come to an office every day. About every 6 months we all get together in person. Our last trips took us to Greece and Spain. Everyone on the team shares a passion for creating the best possible product and user experience, and that is something we value in future team members as well. 

The Roger Story

Roger's founders started the company after exiting their first startup to Cisco Systems. Having experienced all the frustrations with daily financial operations when starting previous ventures, the first gist of an idea for Roger was born in 2016. Since then, international investors from both Europe and the US have supported the growth of the team and the customer base, and the product is now used and loved by more than 1,000 customers worldwide. 

Roger is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Looking for that perfect startup opp? Join a high growth, OMERS ventures backed, startup and work with brands like Dell, Paypal, Nike and Hootsuite. Our team has scaled AI technology from 0 to 100m users and businesses from 0 to $100m+. Klue is BC Tech's Startup of the Year, one of BC's Ready to Rocket emerging tech companies, a Deloitte Fast 50 Company to Watch, a C100 48 Hours in the Valley Audience Choice Winner, a Top 20 CIX Canadian Innovator and the runner up in the Startup World Cup global championships held in San Francisco.

**The Role:**   
Integrate Klue with SFDC: pull data into Klue from our clients' SFDC / Salesforce.com repository and push Klue data back into their SFDC install. Your role will be to develop a SFDC app and deploy it to the AppExchange to enable our clients to easily connect Klue into their system. Configure and integrate APIs and Web Services between Salesforce, Klue and other applications, customization of Salesforce fields, page layouts, record types, reports and dashboards, and provide technical expertise and best practices for SFDC development.

What you can expect from Klue:

1. You'll have a voice, opinions aren’t just welcome, they're expected   
2. You'll work with an experienced team, 100 years of combined biz + tech   
3. You'll work on big problems, the kind 85m companies have   
4. You'll get ground floor options, flexible vacation and free access to a gym   
5. You'll choose your own equipment   
6. No politics, no posers: open, honest, I've-got-your-back environment

**Requirements**

1. Salesforce Certified Platform Developer or App Builder   
2. Experience building and deploying apps on SFDC Platform/Exchange   
3. Familiarity with service isolation, load balancing, git/heroku/aws   
4. You've specified REST apis on multiple stacks   
5. You're worked in agile, iterative development, mockups to production   
6. You're ramping in open source languages frameworks, ideally Ruby/Rails

**Benefits**

Flexible work schedule

Room to grow

Great team

At Klue, we are building an environment where our employees feel included and heard. Diversity and inclusion are important to us and we strongly encourage applications from minorities, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

highlightedJobListings.description:
We’re FarApp, a rapidly growing e-commerce automation solution company. It sounds like a lot of buzz words, but we really are growing fast and want to bring in new talented folks to help manage our rapidly expanding customer base. We hope that we can find that talent in you!

FarApp is a SAAS company who has been in business for over 15 years. In those 15 years we’ve expanded our original codebase to over 1.5 million lines of code processing millions of operations a day. We connect to over 60 endpoints to help our customers become versatile e-commerce participants.  

What will you be doing?

You’ll be diving into our code and figuring out ways to permanently solve problems that our customers either create or point out. This requires that you have a comfort with reading code in the context of a larger system without fear and that you're willing to try out and test solutions. You need to be comfortable deploying code 10 times a day into a live environment as you solve real-world problems. 

You’ll also be helping to expand our product line. We add new endpoints to our service all the time, meaning that we must develop new connectors to integrate within our current system. That could mean something simple like a new logistics company, or it could be a new marketplace that has popped up that people are flocking to. 

You’ll also be participating in our continuing effort to reduce our integration time. Currently, we have an average integration time for new customers of 40 days. We strongly believe we can reduce that to less than a day, maybe less than a couple of hours. We need your creative, intelligent ideas and initiative to make that happen. 

We're looking for somebody who is passionate about software and is interested to start at the ground-level with a company so that they can help it grow and share in its success. We hope that you're excited to make a big impact because you'll have plenty of opportunities to do that. We don't need somebody with a lot of experience but just need somebody who can learn new technologies quickly and is excited to make learning part of their regular routine.

Cool things:
Competitive salary with great benefits
Working from home!  
We offer health, dental and vision plans. 
We have a 401k plan. 
Vacation and unlimited sick time
Bi-annual raises and performance-based bonuses.

Things you need (requirements):

-BS Degree in Computer Science or related field
-3.0 minimum GPA
-Strong communication skills
-Knowledge in Python, Flask, TurboGears, AngularJS is a plus
-Experience with eCommerce marketplaces and/or platforms and APIs is a plus

highlightedJobListings.description:
### About DVELP

DVELP is a London based software development consultancy.

We work with leading brands like Nike, Soho House and Twilio helping them to build secure, robust platforms for highly sensitive data.

Our experience ranges from designing and delivering end-to-end digital banking solutions, through to bespoke internal communication tools for the hospitality sector.

We have a strong engineering background, which remains at the centre of everything we do.

We are currently hiring for a Senior Ruby/Rails Developer to join our team. We are looking for like minded engineer, who is the master of their craft and with experience in leading a team.

To learn more about our approach to both business and coding, please check out our cookbook: https://github.com/DVELP/cookbook.


### Key Responsibilities

- Lead and advise on entire projects
- Be hands-on in new and existing code bases
- Working with the existing team to set and maintain standards of code quality and best practice across the organisation
- Work closely with the product team to understand, scope and advise on the best approach to achieve a business objective


### About You

- Experienced and comfortable through the entire lifecycle of a feature, from ideation to delivery
- Can understand business drivers and make solid proposals for building new features or refining existing ones
- Are a subject matter expert in at least one programming environment
- Have typically 5-8 years experience in a specific programming domain or language
- Excellent communications skills (native or strong English speaker)
- Experienced working directly with clients or key stakeholders
- Are ambitious and excited to grow with DVELP


### What Next?

We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible, so applications will be considered as and when we receive them.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Chainlink’s developer evangelist is responsible for getting the word out about Chainlink, inspiring and educating developers on smart contracts/oracles, and creating a following for Chainlink as a developer brand. You will be one-part developer with reputable technical credentials, one-part educator passionate about sharing his/her craft, and one-part evangelist showcasing the unique benefits of using Chainlink in decentralized applications.

 
***Key Responsibilities***
- Represent Chainlink at developer conferences and events  by giving speeches, doing live demos of Chainlink, and interacting with attendees
- Take the lead in Chainlink’s own developer events making them best-in-class and catered towards developers
- Inspire and equip developers to use Chainlink. Support Chainlink developers when they need a hand, building a following for yourself and Chainlink
- Contribute to Chainlink’s library of How To’s and Sample Code
- Create and publish technical content (blog posts, troubleshooting/FAQ, case studies, and videos) that will get developers excited about the potential of Chainlink as a developer tool
- Engage with the community via the most popular online mediums, e.g. Github, StackOverflow, Telegram, Discord, etc.
- Be an active and authentic participant in the blockchain and Ethereum developer communities wherever they gather, online and offline
- Provide end-user feedback to Chainlink's Product Management and Engineering teams based on what you’re seeing and hearing in the community
- Pursue general open source growth opportunities and best practices, such as bug reports, bounties programs, and sandboxes

***Job requirements***
- 4-7 years’ experience in the software industry working as a developer, evangelist, or dev-tools expert
- Passion for the blockchain space and its power to change the world for the better
- Proficiency in Golang, JavaScript, Rust, and/or Solidity or a keen interest in learning new languages
- Strong engineering skills; experience in building web and/or mobile applications
- Strong technical writing skills; ability to clearly communicate complex ideas and concepts
- Social and hustling skills; a desire to get out and meet people
- Solid public speaking experience with a comfort level around coding in front of a live audience
- Passion to inspire and educate fellow developers
- Experience in a developer evangelist role
- Ability to work in a startup environment
- Willingness to travel and work irregular hours when required
- Community experience including organizing meetups
- Understanding of the blockchain ecosystem
- Passion for building a developer community around the world and desire to invest your energy to make them better

This role is location agnostic. You can be based in a major metro area within the US with access to direct flights. 

*Chainlink is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

Please apply directly if interested at https://careers.chain.link/o/developer-evangelist-global

highlightedJobListings.description:
Overview

 

Multi is a margin-first crypto exchange, built out of frustration with the lack of products, no user-centric development and transparency.


We are hiring a Head of Security to solve and manage problems and risks in all areas relating to security and data protection, as well as implementing the highest security standards and processes within the industry.


You will be building out the security strategies to detect, analyse and respond to cybersecurity incidents, using a combination of technology solutions and a strong set of pragmatic processes. This will include the continued implementation and management of open source SIEM platforms and other technologies to further strengthen our security.


You will keep current with major threats & known vulnerabilities, review sensitive parts of the code base. You will assist & validate the setup for both cold and hot wallets, and you will review the code and note any vulnerabilities. You should have a working knowledge of some of the following: JS, C/C++, MySQL, Kafka, Redis, Express, Linux, AWS, Docker & Terraform. You should know how to operate production systems securely and offer advice & best practices.


Responsibilities:

 

Keeps current on the current IT threat landscape and upcoming trends in security
First response to security events
Assist in administering & validating systems for best security practices
Review code and assist in deploying & managing configurations securely in production
Detect, escalate, and assist in remediation of critical information security incidents.
Document and communicate findings, escalate critical incidents, and interact with customers
Perform intrusion analysis using SIEM technology, packet captures, reports, data visualization, log analysis and pattern analysis.
Improve and challenge existing processes and procedures in a very agile and fast moving information security environment.
Maintains knowledge of information security policies and goals

 

  Requirements:

Certifications from EC-Council, GIAC, (ISC) or equivalent are preferred
2+ years experience with JS
Previous experience of physical cybersecurity
Working knowledge of C is a plus
Experience securing & working with microservices
SIEM Systems, DLP Systems
Information Security Tools (e.g. firewalls, anti-virus, web filtering, email filtering)
5+ Yrs of relevant work experience
BA/BS or Equivalent work experience

 What we offer:

A never-boring work environment
Play a meaningful role in an upcoming crypto exchange, joining in the early days and being involved in its growth.
Competitive salary
Potential equity
An international team across 3 continents
highlightedJobListings.title: Security Engineer

highlightedJobListings.description:
You will be part of the development team of Nexiona, designing, implementing, maintaining and supporting our products: MIIMETIQ COMPOSER, MIIMETIQ LITE, and MIIMETIQ Edge. The development team also takes care of using these same products for developing end-user IoT projects for strategic customers that put their trust on us for the integration of their final solution.

For convenience, we generally tend to distinguish between backend and frontend engineers, although all team members proactively take tasks from areas outside of their confort zone if needed. The usual backend-oriented tasks involve working in the REST APIs, developing new features (machine learning nowledge is a plus!) integrating and optimizing different databases and other 3rd-party services (MongoDB, Graphite, InfluxDB, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ, Grafana, NodeRED...), integrating different messaging protocols at platform-level (AMQP, MQTT, CoAP, STOMP...), implementing the firmware of the hardware used in end-user projects (Yocto, OpenWRT) and using different industrial automation protocols (Modbus, Profinet, Profibus, CAN, OPC-UA...) for monitoring and controlling real industrial devices. The programming languages used in backend services are mainly Python, Go, Erlang and Typescript (and we are not afraid to experiment!). Also, Docker is ubiquitous in our infrastructure and it is responsibility of the same developer to take care of the deployment code for the microservice or application being developed.

Currently the team is self-organized following the Kanban methodology. The team is 100% remote, with a majority of team members from Barcelona and Catalonia, but also from other regions of Spain and other countries of Europe (for schedule synchronization, we restrict our candidate search to CET +/- 2h time-zone). Whenever the team decides (usually every 5 weeks) we meet in person at the Barcelona offices during a couple of days, to boost the human interaction within the team as well as the colleagues of rest of the company departments. 


We don't require/expect all applicants to be proficient in every one of these technologies. Instead, here in Nexiona we search for people excited to learn every day something new, not afraid of the unknown. At the end, the key to being part of Nexiona is the passion for crafting good software with love.
highlightedJobListings.title: Software Engineer (backend-oriented)

highlightedJobListings.description:
Nexiona is hiring! Looking for a passionate software engineer with Typescript experience to be part of our development team.

Apply here: https://goo.gl/forms/owdZkwXOUMpKX8ZV2

We are a passionate team born in Barcelona and dedicated to the Internet of Things. We offer different tools that allow the creation of powerful IoT solutions for the industry. We seduce our customers with innovative features and cutting-edge technologies. We build their trust by investing in software quality, security, and performance. We keep them with a caring and dedicated human relationship.

You will be part of the development team of Nexiona, designing, implementing, maintaining and supporting our products: MIIMETIQ COMPOSER, MIIMETIQ LITE, and MIIMETIQ Edge. The development team also uses these same products to develop end-user IoT projects for strategic customers that put their trust on us for the integration of their final solution.

For convenience, we generally tend to distinguish between backend and frontend engineers, although all team members proactively take tasks from areas outside of their comfort zone if needed. In the frontend area, the stack of our multiple UI applications is composed of Typescript, React, Material-UI, Redux, Redux-Loop, Jsonous and TsMonad, and follows a functional programming architecture and style. The usual tasks of a frontend-oriented engineer involve designing, implementing and maintaining the UI of the features of the products, as well as the UI applications of the end-user projects. 

Currently the team is self-organized following the Kanban methodology. The team is 100% remote, with a majority of team members from Catalonia, but also from other parts of Spain and other countries of Europe (for schedule synchronization, we restrict our candidate search to CET +/- 2h time-zone). Whenever the team decides (usually every 5 weeks) we meet in person at the Barcelona offices during a couple of days to boost the human interaction within the technical team and with the colleagues from the other departments of the company.

The salary offer ranges from 30K to 40K € gross annual salary (we are open to consider a higher salary in exceptional occasions). We don't require/expect all applicants to be proficient in every one of the technologies we use. Instead, here at Nexiona we search for people excited to learn something new every day, not afraid of the unknown. At the end, the key to being part of Nexiona is the passion for crafting good software with love.

The company is facing an exponential growth that is leading the exciting path from a startup to a consolidated business. We need your help to get there! Will you miss this opportunity?

highlightedJobListings.description:
WeavAir is recruiting a CTO to lead the development of software infrastructure and architecture for large-scale IoT sensor device data collection, aggregation, real-time processing, predictive modeling and visualization. The CTO is a key part of our team and is responsible for the development of innovative enterprise class applications. If you’ve got the skills and experience and want to work with our international team, please send your cover letter and CV today (natalia@weavair.com).

Requirements:
-	Background in software engineering
-	Background in big data processing, querying and storage as well as web applications performance optimization
-	Experience with technical management in software product company
-	Knowledge and expertise on cloud deployments
-	Strong understanding of web application reliability strategies
-	Strong understanding of hardware performance (including processor cores & IO throughput) and network performance (nodes communication through private network & internet).
-	Strong understanding of IoT and web applications security, including hardware & software levels 
-	Experience creating dashboards and attractive data visualizations
-	Experience developing APIs and SDKs
-	Good English skills (oral and written)
Will be a plus:
-	Experience with AI and ML solutions.
-	Experience with CI/CD (including but not limited to version control)
-	Familiarity with Google Analytics or similar analytics suites
-	Basic understanding of user tracking technologies, including JavaScript and mobile platforms tracking
-	Basic understanding of analytics methods and approaches, including slicing, sampling, forecasting and providing statistically significant results
We offer:
-	Opportunity to work with a global team in Canada, South Korea, Taiwan and Chile
-	Flexible working hours/ remote days
-	Free books and conferences
-	Interesting tasks and challenges
-	Opportunities for enhancement
-	Friendly Environment
-	Opportunity to make a positive impact
-	Media exposure (if interested)
-	Travel opportunities (if interested)
-	Free English courses (if interested)
We’re looking for CTO to ensure delivery of high-quality analytical products to customers. This includes:
-	Technical strategy planning and implementing, based on company strategy.
-	Ensuring that the technological resources meet the company’s short and long-term needs
-	Managing technology budgets and time frames
-	Ensuring cost efficiency, high quality and delivery on time
-	Hiring, training and assessing team
-	Architectural plans assessment in terms of business value, cost efficiency, scalability and security
-	Quality assurance, middleware and security management
-	Communication with customers to understand their needs and generate the best solutions
-	Staying on top of technology trends and developments, consistently evaluating and enhancing technical efficiency
-	Ensuring all technology practices adhere to regulatory standards

About us:
WeavAir is an award-winning IoT technology company that harnesses advanced sensor technology and predictive analytics to improve indoor air quality, save energy & streamline operations in buildings. WeavAir has operations in Canada, Taiwan, Korea and Chile. The company is a winner of the prestigious Clean50 Top Project, Le Monde Smart City Award, IoT/WT Innovation World Cup and was named the “Most Innovative Startup” by SAP. We also received first place in Singularity University Competition, United Nations Citypreneur competition and received WeGo Smart City Secretary General's award. WeavAir has also been named as one of the top international startups in Korea by National IT Industry Promotion Agency.
WeavAir is recruiting creative and driven people who would like to have a real impact on the world and improve the way our buildings and cities are managed. By joining WeavAir, you will be part of a growing and fast-paced start-up with the opportunity to lead new projects with passionate, creative and diverse team. You will be given opportunity to learn and grow, manage exciting projects with large corporate clients and gain invaluable experience working in a diverse team. Flexible schedule and remote work opportunities are available, if there is interest. Opportunities for media exposure and work with leaders in private and public sector will also be available.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Looking for a job where you’ll gain significant equity while having a huge impact on product innovation? Lootcakes is a small but fast-growing games data and marketing venture that already counts some of the world’s top game publishers as clients. The Lootcakes team has deep experience in games and ad tech, with multiple exits under our belt.

Our mission is to empower gamers to harness their data. We’ve created an innovative way to help both players and publishers of mobile and PC games, with data at the heart of the equation. On our B2C side, we reward players for sharing their valuable-as-gold game purchase data. On our B2B side, we leverage our data to help publishers acquire high-value players. 

We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer to scale our network, build mission-critical products, and unleash the power of our data. You will be a senior and foundational member of our technology team, working directly with the co-founders and COO.  We’re a distributed team across NYC, Seattle, and Denver and you can work from any location in the US. 

You might be a fit if you:
●	Are self-motivated and driven to learn and implement new technologies
●	Enjoy a fast-paced, entrepreneurial culture
●	Have deep, well-balanced skills (front-end, back-end, database, DevOps)
●	Embrace agile/lean development methodologies
●	Communicate well with product and business team members
●	Love games!

What you would do:
●	Build the next generation of our mobile-optimized B2C platform
●	Deploy machine learning to fully leverage our valuable user data
●	Help architect and build our first mobile app and our first B2B site
●	Scale our service to handle millions of users
●	Build internal tools for business operations, data viz and analytics
●	Develop and integrate advertising technology
●	Securely manage sensitive data
●	Help build our tech team

Qualifications:
●	5+ years of experience 
●	Experience with B2C web/mobile
●	Experience balancing growth (e.g. conversion optimization) alongside  medium to longer-term development initiatives
●	Experience deploying ML libraries/algorithms a big plus
●	Must be proficient in the following skills/languages:
   	○	.NET (C#, MVC)
	  ○	Front-end (CSS, js/jQuery)
	  ○	T-SQL
	  ○	Database design/management
	  ○	Azure (or AWS)/Windows Server Management
●	Experience with the following platforms/tools a plus: Advertising technology, Google Analytics, ServiceStack, Hangfire, Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, Redgate SQL Change Automation, and Team Foundation Server
●	We only consider candidates authorized to work in the US and fluent in English.
●	We will not consider contractors working for software development outsourcing companies to fill the needs of this role. If you fit that description, please do not inquire.

What we offer:
●	Competitive salary and significant equity in a fast-growing company
●	100% paid health, dental, and vision insurance
●	Healthcare FSA, Short-term Disability, Life Insurance, AD&D, One Medical
●	Paid vacation and sick days
●	Work from home

We’re passionate about building one of the great games industry growth stories of the next decade. If you’re interested to join a fast-paced venture just as things are really taking off, send us your resume and feel free to include a cover letter.

You will act as a mentor to incoming interns/students and you will periodically be asked to teach the team something new during weekly meetings.  You will detail your goals while working with SAAVHA and we will help ensure they are met.  Lastly, you will have some indirect and direct work related fun!

Matt is a physician turned tech entrepreneur who creates the company vision.  On occasion, you will have the opportunity to interact with our founding advisors.  Jeremy a well-known crypto-celebrity who travels the world and manages his new venture capital fund.  And Colin, who translated his Ph.D. in physics and East Asian languages into hospital and defense department software applications.  

Wearing your innovative hat, we will turn the complex systems into easy to use security solutions that fit customers needs.

If you have any questions, please feel free to email us at careers@saavha.com.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Gospic - Reveal Your World.

Gospic is shaking up the $40b social media market through its unique social-gaming mobile app. On Gospic, users have a mission in each photo they share with their friends, choosing the game beforehand and earning Likes as a reward every time they successfully win the game. While all the existing and new platforms try to copy each other, Gospic wants to create something really groundbreaking, that the world has never seen, and that will allow Generation Z to connect with their friends in a really fun and unique way. Gospic has already reached TOP 5 in the Greek AppStore, exhibited in some of the biggest tech conferences in the world, and won prizes in accelerator programs. We are currently looking to create a team that will help us make Gospic popular worldwide and give to the new generation a new, fun and data safe platform to connect with their friends.

The Role:

You will work closely with a product manager and the head of a business department to achieve Gospic's goals. Your projects can range from developing photo and video processing to launching growth hacking techniques. You will be one of the earliest engineers so you will be taking ownership of your projects and making a big impact on the business. You'll be building the front-end while pairing with a back-end engineer who will provide an API for you to consume.

About You 
* You think from the customer's point of view first 
* You stay late at work to get the user experience just right 
* You excel in a fast-paced and fast-changing environment. You like to release and iterate quickly 
* You can handle some uncertainty and ambiguity and still take the next step 
* You're humble, open-minded, and receptive to feedback 
* You enjoy teaching others what you have learned 
* You're a great teammate. Others are excited to work on a project with you
* You are willing to take risks and become a major shareholder in a business that can become huge

Tech Stack:
*iOS programming
*Swift language
*Low Level photo and video processing (OpenGL, GPUImage etc.) 

Benefits:
*Become a major shareholder
*100% Work remotely
*You'll be your own boss

We do not accept calls from 3rd party recruiters.
highlightedJobListings.title: Software Engineer - iOS

highlightedJobListings.description:
OpenCounter is seeking an Implementation Specialist to help us improve the deployment of our permitting and licensing software for municipal governments.

Configuration involves translating municipal regulations (like permit fee schedules and zoning rules) into the language of our proprietary rules engine -- “translating the municipal code into executable code”, as we say.

The Implementation Specialist will work with our Project Managers to understand the requirements of our clients, and develop best practices to streamline the deployment of our functionality according to the project delivery schedule. The role will also interface with our Engineering Team to continue to improve our rules engine and CMS.

OBJECTIVES

• Understand and manage the complexity of our rules engine with our growing product.
• Improve how the language is used in implementing projects to ensure scalability (across projects) and sustainability (within projects).

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Assist Project Managers in setting up the OpenCounter software quickly and accurately for each client. 
• Work with Engineering to identify opportunities for improvement and surface potential problems.
• Lead advanced implementations.
• Train new Project Managers on best practices and patterns of this language.

QUALIFICATIONS

• Strong technical background
• Some experience working in or with public agencies (can include City, County, State Federal, Higher Ed and Public Health)
• Excellent project management, time management and organizational skills

WORKPLACE
 
Open Counter is growing quickly as it transitions from a lean, bootstrapped startup into an autonomous business unit at a publicly-traded company. OpenCounter is fully remote at present, with offices and employment clusters in Boston and San Francisco and outposts in another four states. 

Training for this role will take place in the SF Bay Area, as well as Seattle and/or Las Vegas. 
 
We also hold bi-annual retreats for our team in rotating locations. The next team offsite is scheduled for Q2 of 2020, which we would like you to attend. 

REPORTS TO

Linh Vuong - Director of Accounts
 
START DATE
 
This position opens on January 1, 2020

COMPENSATION

DOE

BENEFITS
 
OpenCounter offers Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance, and covers 99% of the plan costs for employees, and 50% for dependents.

We plan to offer a 401k in 2020. 

ABOUT OPENCOUNTER

OpenCounter is building a new generation of permitting and licensing software for state and local governments. The company was incubated at Code for America in 2012, and was a winner of the Knight News Challenge for Open Government in 2013. Since then, we’ve scaled to serving 60 of the largest cities in the country (San Diego, Atlanta, Detroit, Orlando, among others). In 2019, we were acquired by GTY Technology Inc. to become part of the preeminent public sector SaaS platform. Our goal is to build modern tools that help cities streamline service delivery, improve citizen engagement, and promote economic development. We are currently seeking an Implementation Specialist to help us support – and learn from – our growing customer base.
highlightedJobListings.title: Implementation Specialist

highlightedJobListings.description:
Technical Lead or Technical Co-founder for Screen360.tv

Screen360.tv is fundraising to meet a $250K matching grant; if it is met, we begin in February 2020. 

Screen360.tv is a platform where young audiences can meet their local, regional and international peers to watch expertly curated foreign films and respond together across time and geographical borders. The platform also serves as a teaching tool for emerging film students seeking to make a more authentic film for young audiences with the Design Thinking process. We believe that multilingual, empathetic and curious learners are cornerstones of a healthy society. Immersive, cross-cultural experiences gained through international education and travel inarguably cultivate such citizens. We extend that to all learners through Cinema.
Screen360.tv needs an adept technical co-founder as we take the next steps to our launch. Screen360.tv is currently led by Catherine Kavanaugh and a team of Bay Area-based advisors. We seek an adept technical co-founder to add to a well-tested prototype, developed at Stanford Graduate School of Education and Hasso Plattner Institute of Design (d.School).
The CTO will join a human-centered design mindset which engages its users, Young audiences and emerging filmmakers, throughout the development cycle. Salary negotiable + equity.
Requirements:
● Love international Cinema and understand the value of Cinema shared in community.
● Happy to support other departments and work multidisciplinarily in a small start-up.
● Magnanimous, post-heroic, visionary. Ready to manage a growing technical team.
● Enjoy pitching in English. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
● Experienced developer looking to work in a burgeoning U.S. field with EU partners
(where the field is stronger.)
● Strong point of view on how to build scalable machine learning infrastructure
● Familiarity with/have an opinion about AWS and other cloud computing platforms.
● Have an understanding/action plan for profile registration tag matching and scheduling
mechanisms; archiving and retrieving video.
● Proficient in C++ and C programming with having experience of x86/64 or arm
assembly coding as well as Python and Ruby in Windows and Mac, Android or Apple
● Solid understanding of video codec.
● Experience with working with video coding standards such as VVC, AV1, HEVC,
H.264/AVC,SVC, AVS, VPx. Experience with video coding standards reference software
such as VTM, JEM, HM, SHM, JM and JSVM preferred.
● Have knowledge of internet security and awareness of SOPIPA, COPPA and FERPA.
You will join Catherine Kavanaugh, co-founder of three international film festivals for young audiences - the latest, Screen360.tv is considered a "Positive Peace Technology at the Stanford Peace Innovation Institute. She transferred her work to the digital realm at Stanfords d.School and Grad School of Ed. Substantiating Screen360.tv's value in Education is evidence of the impact of international film on childhood autobiographical memory, research done in collaboration with the Berlin Film Festival's ​Generation ​section. Kavanaugh has sustained a long-term vision of cultural literacy and rich learning through redesign of access to the rich resources held in latent cinema archives.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Primer

We make it possible to envision changes to your home instantly with AR. It’s hard to imagine what finishes like paint color, tile, or wallpaper will look like in your space. Today, homeowners have to make big remodeling decisions using online photos and tiny material samples. With advanced technology and intuitive software design, we’re making it easy to preview thousands of finishes from curated brands in your space, instantly.

Our Vision

We’re building the future where your phone becomes a magic lens through which you can instantly visualize any change to your home. With materials from curated brands, inspiring ideas that launch directly into AR, and smart suggestions based on your existing decor, we aim to become the starting point for every remodel. The $130B renovation market is ready: 74% of consumers now say they expect retailers to offer some way to view products in AR. We’re building the future consumers want, saving them time, money, and frustration.

Day to Day

- You will be responsible for building, maintaining, and expanding the capabilities of our iOS app and its backend.
- You’ll champion new technologies, thoughtful architecture and thorough development processes.
- You’ll prototype creative solutions to unique challenges posed by AR to constantly improve the user experience and expand what’s possible in a cutting-edge medium.
- You’ll work with technologies like Swift, Objective-C, SwiftUI, UIKit, SceneKit, ARKit, and Ruby to create delightful and simple user experiences.
- You’ll collaborate directly with founders to determine how we might leverage technology to meet customer and business needs.
- You’ll participate in research to better understand customer needs and work with the team to shape technology and product strategy around those learnings.
- You’ll participate in hiring passionate and talented team members across all disciplines.

Your Skills

- You are a proficient engineer with 5+ years of professional iOS development experience, working across the stack from back-end to UI polish.
- You have an eye not only for how something works, but also how it feels. - - - You take pride in building delightful and performant products.
- You excel at understanding and breaking down complex problems. You have remarkable attention to detail. You reason from first principles.
- You deeply value owning and driving your work, roadmap, and working to set company priorities in partnership with the founding team.
- You’re direct and honest. You can adapt your communication style to different audiences and you can confidently break down tricky topics in writing and in person.
- You are self-driven and make things happen. You show a strong desire to succeed and are always looking for opportunities to learn and grow.
- You get a lot done quickly and can translate your skills into new processes that your team will follow.
- You will rapidly grow into a company leader. You will work with the founders to build company culture and help shape our future.

Extra Credit 

- You have experience working in a fast-paced early stage startup
- You have cross-platform experience developing for Android
- You have experience working with ARKit and/or SceneKit
- You have experience developing or working with 3D rendering pipelines
- You have experience developing or working with computer vision libraries

Our Values

- We value high-performing, creative individuals who never lose sight of the why.
- We believe the way to create an efficient company is to hire great people, build autonomous teams, and set clear goals that ladder into a bigger vision.
- We value an environment where individuals can bring their whole selves to work and be fully present at home. We support to this through great health care, parental leave, and flexibility for the things that come up in life.
- We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company. 
- We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

Founding Team

Co-founders Russ and Adam teamed up in February of 2019 to make the experience of remodeling easier. Backed by top Silicon Valley firms such as Designer Fund, Slow Ventures, and Foundation Capital, we have years of product and tech experience at companies like Google and Facebook, and with brands like Lady Gaga and Porsche. Our team of engineers and designers are uniquely positioned to reinvent the design and decision making process of remodeling.

Benefits

- Work with a world-class team of designers and engineers who have built products used by hundreds of millions at Facebook, Google, and Mapbox.
- Full medical, dental, and vision insurance
- Unlimited paid time off
- Latest and greatest equipment
- Newly renovated private office in revitalized downtown Oakland

Lootcakes is a small but fast-growing games data and marketing venture that already counts some of the world’s top game publishers as clients. The Lootcakes team has deep experience in games and ad tech, with multiple exits under our belt.

Our mission is to empower gamers to harness their data. We’ve created an innovative way to help both players and publishers of mobile and PC games, with data at the heart of the equation. On our B2C side, we reward players for sharing their valuable-as-gold game purchase data. On our B2B side, we leverage our data to help publishers acquire high-value players. 

We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer to scale our network, build mission-critical products, and unleash the power of our data. You will be a senior and foundational member of our technology team, working directly with the co-founders and COO.  We’re a distributed team across NYC, Seattle, and Denver and you can work from any location in the US. 

You might be a fit if you:
●	Are self-motivated and driven to learn and implement new technologies
●	Enjoy a fast-paced, entrepreneurial culture
●	Have deep, well-balanced skills (front-end, back-end, database, DevOps)
●	Embrace agile/lean development methodologies
●	Communicate well with product and business team members
●	Love games!

What you would do:
●	Build the next generation of our mobile-optimized B2C platform
●	Deploy machine learning to fully leverage our valuable user data
●	Help architect and build our first mobile app and our first B2B site
●	Scale our service to handle millions of users
●	Build internal tools for business operations, data viz and analytics
●	Develop and integrate advertising technology
●	Securely manage sensitive data
●	Help build our tech team

Qualifications:
●	5+ years of experience 
●	Experience with B2C web/mobile
●	Experience balancing growth (e.g. conversion optimization) alongside  medium to longer-term development initiatives
●	Experience deploying ML libraries/algorithms a big plus
●	Must be proficient in the following skills/languages:
   	○	.NET (C#, MVC)
	  ○	Front-end (CSS, js/jQuery)
	  ○	T-SQL
	  ○	Database design/management
	  ○	Azure (or AWS)/Windows Server Management
●	Experience with the following platforms/tools a plus: Advertising technology, Google Analytics, ServiceStack, Hangfire, Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, Redgate SQL Change Automation, and Team Foundation Server
●	We only consider candidates authorized to work in the US and fluent in English.
●	We will not consider contractors working for software development outsourcing companies to fill the needs of this role. If you fit that description, please do not inquire.

What we offer:

●	100% paid health, dental, and vision insurance
