highlightedJobListings.description:
We’re getting ready to launch our first synthetic voice Lucy! Vocal production traditionally requires a singer, a recording studio, and a sound engineer. We are making it as simple as opening a plugin. Emvoice is at the forefront of a new market: on-demand, flexible, high-quality voices for all genres of music. 

A Software Engineer and Cofounder opportunity with equity compensation (salary to follow in mid-2020) is available for the right candidate. Beyond the audio software market, we have big plans in voice tech. Despite getting an “AI injection” for some of them, current text-to-speech technologies are greedy, brittle, and their output is boring. We can change this and transform user experience with vocal assistants. 

Requirements:
- Strong C++ skills. Experience developing audio plugins is a plus.
- Understanding of networking protocols and web development.
- Ability to work independently and remotely, while maintaining communication with team members.

What we offer:
- A no-nonsense, transparent, and open company culture that embraces diversity.
- 100% remote work. Our team is distributed across the globe - Paris, Bangkok, London and cities across the US.
- A place where you can learn, grow, and drive innovation. 
 
Our users (beta) are raving about Emvoice. The most common words are “awesome”, “great”, “amazing”. Some say it’s “epic”, “wild”, or that Lucy sounds “gorgeous”. 

https://youtu.be/MQVkVtNa7BI

highlightedJobListings.description:
Mobilestack Inc is developing innovative network connectivity solutions. 


We are a very small team today . So, this is an exciting opportunity for WiFi Router Expert to join us and become part of early-stage startup team that is growing very fast. 

For our Managed WiFi Services, we are looking for a Captive-Portal Developer who has good understanding of Coova-Chilli or WiFiDog based Captive-Portal for WiFi Guest Management Services. 

Job Responsibilities:

Being a lead developer on a project to add innovative features

Contribute to design and development of new networking features and feature enhancements for existing software

Communicate effectively with peers to highlight and clarify software implementation

Modify existing open source router firmware

Be responsible for all aspects of software development including design, coding, testing, and debugging

Minimum Job Qualifications :

Practical experience with developing features for WiFi routers 

Deep understanding of Coova-Chilli or WiFiDog Open Source Software

3+ years of C/C++ coding experience for Linux systems (user-space system programming, network programming)

Strong debugging, troubleshooting, and performance-tuning skills

Ability to follow good programming practices and work in a startup environment

Excellent written communication skills, articulate and proactive

Strong team player and independent contributor

Preferred Job Qualifications:

Practical knowledge of 802.1x protocols

Linux Networking Drivers and System Software development experience particularly for DHCP, ZeroConfig, DNS,Firewall, Remote Configuration


Culture

We need people with "startup" mentality who enjoys the thrill of doing a startup. Mobilestack Inc mission is to change the way Edge-GW provide value to our customers with "vendor locking" and give full-flexibility of choosing HW to our customers.
highlightedJobListings.title: Cloud-based Captive Portal Developer

Our business model is to provide a software based on core technology in the field of image recognition and modification 

Our ultimate objective is to realize what humanity had been envisioning through Machine Learning/AI

highlightedJobListings.description:
**Job description**

WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We're looking for a highly skilled and motivated Front-End Developer for a full-time, permanent, remote position.

**Responsibilities**

* Communicate with backend person in order to integrate API's with Ul
* Angular-based development
* SDK integration of Facebook, Twitter, and Google SDK's (know how each one is used and interacted with)
* Be able to slice PSD's to pixel perfection, including margins, paddings, line heights and font sizes
* Keep up-to-date with the latest standards and techniques concerning CSS and HTML5

**Skills and qualifications**

You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:

* Minimum 2 years of experience with Javascript, CSS, HTML5 and Angular
* Exceptional knowledge of web standards, CSS3-based design and cross-browser compatibility
* Very strong experience with Slicing
* AMP optimization knowledge is a plus
* Organized and punctual: able to manage your own time and never miss a deadline
* Willingness to work hard
* Fluent in spoken/written English

**Nice to have but not required**

* Experience in PHP
* Familiarity with front-end technologies – Object-Oriented Javascript, AJAX, XHTML, HTML, XML/DOM
* Experience with unit testing framework, test driven development

**Compensation**

* Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
* Potential for stock options after the first year
* Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
* Health benefits (in case you will be working from our office in Washington, D.C.)
* Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the U.S.)

**Notes**

Expected work schedule is 50 hours/week, Monday to Friday. In case you will be working from outside the U.S., please be aware this position requires an overlap with EST business hours.

Although we appreciate your interest in working with us, due to the high number of applications we receive, we will only be able to reply to successful applicants.

**More about WalletHub**

WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, DC that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:

1) **Customized Credit-Improvement Tips**: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

2) **Personalized Money-Saving Advice**: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

3) **Wallet Surveillance**: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.

In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.

highlightedJobListings.description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the U.S. and rapidly growing. We're looking for a highly skilled and motivated Senior Java Developer for a full-time, permanent position.

**Responsibilities**

* Designs and develops web applications using Java, Spring Framework, MySQL
* Designs and develops unit test cases to make the code more robust
* Participates in pairing and code reviews
* Supports and troubleshoots problems with existing applications
* Participates in the areas of architecture, design, implementation, and testing

**Qualifications**

You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:

* Over 3 years experience in Java, Spring and MySQL (or any relational database)
* Experience developing web and stand-alone applications in Spring technologies, such as Spring MVC, Spring Security, Spring Batch
* Proven ability to lead a small group of developers and the willingness to mentor junior developers
* Excellent communication and analytical skills
* Willingness to work hard
* Proficient with spoken/written English

**Nice to have but not required:**

* Experience in PHP
* Familiarity with front-end technologies – Object-Oriented Javascript, AJAX, XHTML, HTML, XML/DOM
* Experience with unit testing framework, test driven development

**Compensation**

* Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
* Potential for stock options after the first year
* Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
* Visa sponsorship (after 18 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the U.S.)

**Notes**

This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely (including from outside the U.S.).

Expected work schedule is 50 hours/week, Monday to Friday. In case you will be working from outside the U.S., please be aware this position requires an overlap with EST business hours (8am - 7pm ET, including 1 hour break).

* Potential for stock options after the first year
* Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the U.S.)
 
**Notes**

**Expected work schedule is 55 hours/week, Monday to Friday. In case you will be working from outside the U.S., please be aware this position requires a full overlap with EST business hours (7AM - 7PM ET, including 1 hr break).**

Although we appreciate your interest in working with us, due to the high number of applications we receive, we will only be able to reply to successful applicants.

**More about WalletHub**

WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, DC that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:

1) **Customized Credit-Improvement Tips:** WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) **Personalized Money-Saving Advice**: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) **Wallet Surveillance**: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.

In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.

**Responsibilities**

* Testing and assuring high quality performance of website
* Reporting and validating bugs for all components

highlightedJobListings.description:
Do you speak Javascript? Do you have experience with React? 

We’re looking for a talented, passionate, and pragmatic Senior Frontend Engineer to join our remote team of 44 different nationalities.

Here’s Gabriel, our Software Engineer, and Team Lead:

"One of the things I love the most about working at HeartBug is that I have the opportunity to build a product that I can be proud of. Everything we do has the customer in mind. We're building something that millions of people truly want to use and that, at the end of the day, it's an awesome feeling for any Engineer."

You’ll work closely with our designers to create unbeatable human experiences.

We put fun at the heart of everything we do—and set ambitious goals to push things forward. Come help us shape the future

The Role

You will:

Get stuck into the end-to-end lifecycle of features, from concept to deployment.
Contribute to technical and architectural decision-making.
Work in a motley crew of engineers, designers, product owners.
Grow—use your annual learning budget to take the course and go to conferences. There’ll be plenty of opportunities for advancement as well.

You

Here’s what we’re after:

You have a good base of javascript and you know your way around React.
You’ve got experience working on a dynamic product that is ever changing and evolving rapidly.
You take ownership of the code you write.
You’re comfortable picking up new stacks and choosing the right tool to get the job done.
You have experience writing unit and integration tests. You understand that quality is everyone's responsibility.
You’ve got experience working on a dynamic product that is ever changing and evolving rapidly.
You’re an empathetic person with a big appetite for success.
You speak English.

Benefits:

Competitive salary
Choose Your Hours
Health benefits
Work visa sponsorship
Work from home

The Recruitment process:

30 minutes interview with our HR specialist.
Coding challenge (we usually give 15 days to complete it)
1h interview with the manager.
1h interview with the director.
Reference check.
Offer!
Sound good? Hit Apply now and show us what you’ve got.

Not 100% sure about matching expectations? Apply. The worst scenario is constructive feedback from our side.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Get in on the ground floor and help disrupt the secondhand fashion marketplace industry.  Closest Closet is a circular marketplace for used fashion where members use their items as currency.  The secondhand fashion market is massive with +65MM US buyers and is expected to double in 5 years.  Our mission is to extend the life of existing fashion, reduce the amount of clothing in landfills and turn consumers into activists.

closestcloset.org is fully functional, built on Wordpress / Woocommerce infrastructure today.
Seeking a software engineer fluent in wordpress / woocommerce to join our team for the long haul.  Primary role out of the gates will be to help improve the user experience while leading the vision for technology in the future.

**This is an unpaid, equity only, moonlighting position until we are able to secure investment.**

We have had several encouraging conversations with VC firms who would be excited to invest as soon as we can show some traction.  We need to improve the customer experience before we can execute our go to market strategy.  Chicken meet egg.

This is where we need you, an experienced software engineer willing to take a risk for equity stake in the company.   From 1% up to 10% equity and a co-founder title for the right candidate. 

We are seeking someone with a high level of integrity and honesty; someone that genuinely cares about the environment and eager to make an impact. The ideal candidate is someone who is dynamic, can write clean, well-documented code, possesses strong problem-solving skills, and is collaborative at heart. 
 
Requirements:
Demonstrable examples of Wordpress / WooCommerce experience
Expert development skills with CSS 3, HTML 5, JavaScript, jQuery, PHP, SQL
Proven, thorough knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues, Adobe Photoshop, CSS grids & frameworks (Bootstrap, Flexbox, etc.)
A good understanding of PHP objects and classes; knowledge with Advanced Custom Fields is a plus
Proficient with command line for streamlined development (Git, Gulp, etc.)
Proficient with CSS preprocessors like SASS
Experienced in API integration

Nice To Haves:
Prior experience in fashion
Prior experience working in or with startups
Passionate about the environment and building a platform to make an impact. 
HubSpot or other CRM experience is a plus
Experience with popular JavaScript frameworks (react, angular, etc.)
Intermediate knowledge of technical SEO best practices
Developing email templates using frameworks like MJML is a plus
 
Benefits
Equity: Up to 10% equity and a co-founder title for the right candidate 
Moonlighting gig to start until we are able to raise money where a competitive salary and benefits will be provided.

Qualified applicants will get access to our product roadmap to understand what they will be working on.
highlightedJobListings.title: Software Engineer - Potential Co-Founder Opportunity

highlightedJobListings.description:
An unique opportunity to join the Sports Tracker team in a technical leadership position responsible for software engineering and platform performance.

As a co-founder, you will work with the founders to set the direction of the product and the business.
As the CTO, you will oversee all development and be responsible for tech architecture and for maintaining platform health in at times mission critical software for our customers. Given the platforms continued growth and popularity we are approaching some major decisions regarding architecture that will decide the future for Sports Tracker. This might involve re-writing the application in contemporary languages for improved scaling or other suggestions led by you.

Our tech stack is composed of PHP, JS and custom APIs that power our React Native Based Mobile Apps.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Only applications submitted via https://jobs.lever.co/roger/2346bedd-138d-4755-b73e-6c64903c4b0c will be considered

Remote candidates encouraged - we have a remote-first culture. 

About Us

Roger was founded to make day-to-day financial operations like bill pay, expense management, compliance and bookkeeping as worry-free as possible for business owners, finance teams, accountants and bookkeepers. Roger works as an automated layer on top of a company's accounting software, saving businesses and accountants hours of work every day. We're proud of the product that we've built so far, and our 1,000+ global customers base agree that we're making something complex and tedious simple and maybe even fun. 

We are backed by some of the best investors in the financial technology and just raised $7.3m. We have huge ambitions for our growth in 2019. But we are still a small team and therefore we want you to be part of the journey.
Joining Roger will be chance to join a fast-paced company, with a global product. We hire for attitude and not credentials. Please apply regardless of your current position background, or experience.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Engineer to run our integration efforts with our services. Our product integrates with a number of different services, such as accounting platforms like QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, as well as collaboration tools like Slack, Box and Dropbox. Allowing our customers to set up custom workflows that fit their exact needs is a core part of our product experience. We have an existing integration framework and a robust API in place, but we are looking to add a new team member to own the integration work end-to-end. This includes building new, as well as maintaining and improving the existing ones - all to ensure a stellar user experience.

You'll be working collaboratively with the rest of the engineering team as well as with the product team to drive the implementation and release of new integrations. You'll be familiar with all parts of our stack from end to end, and will drive positive change to Roger's engineering culture, processes and technology.

We see this role as a unique chance to own an important piece of the Roger product, see it grow, and flourish very quickly. 

Your profile

- Excited to work on building the foundations of Roger's integrations ecosystem
- Comfortable working with external partners and managing your projects from A-Z
- Experience in working with object-oriented programming
- Comfortable working with .NET and C#
- Experience working with relational\non-relational, Aurora\MySql and Dynamodb
- Experience with REST APIs

The Team

The engineering team is characterized by a high degree of support internally. We help each other out and pitch in when problems arise as well as give each other feedback to grow. Our top priority is to build the world's best financial automation platforms, while keeping our users safe and compliant. Scalability, reliability and robustness are keywords we live by but we also get excited about building out feature MVPs quickly to keep our innovative reputation with customers and partners alive and well at all times.   

The Stack

Roger's backend is built on .NET with C#. We love the simplicity, speed and structure of C#, combined with the built-in security and robustness it offers developers. On the front-end we work in React and React Native, enabling us to build reliable web experiences that can handle high usage volumes. 

Additionally, we make extensive use of Lamda (integrations only), AWS, Git, Bugsnag, Heroku and other great tools to keep our development processes running smoothly. 

Our Values

We're a global company with offices in Copenhagen and San Francisco. Our values are heavily influenced by our Scandinavian roots (both founders are from Denmark), and count humility, humor and inclusiveness. We strive to create a culture where anyone feels part of the family, and we place a great amount of value in hiring for attitude rather than resumes. We support flexibility in everyone's lives, and working at Roger can be easily combined with babies, toddlers and teenagers. We have two primary office locations but have a remote culture that we put a lot of effort into as we believe great talent can be found anywhere. As a remote worker you can be sure to feel like you are as much part of the team as those who come to an office every day. About every 6 months we all get together in person. Our last trips took us to Greece and Spain. Everyone on the team shares a passion for creating the best possible product and user experience, and that is something we value in future team members as well. 

The Roger Story

Roger's founders started the company after exiting their first startup to Cisco Systems. Having experienced all the frustrations with daily financial operations when starting previous ventures, the first gist of an idea for Roger was born in 2016. Since then, international investors from both Europe and the US have supported the growth of the team and the customer base, and the product is now used and loved by more than 1,000 customers worldwide. 

Roger is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

Slate is a web and mobile product used by some of the top brands in the world to create branded social content in real-time. We have customers from the NFL, NBA, MLB, MLS, EPL as well as some of the largest media brands in the world. 

We are a new company that consists of a small, dedicated, team distributed across the globe. Slate is backed by great investor including Titletown Tech (associated with the Green Bay Packers) and WISE ventures (associated with the Minnesota Vikings). 

We have ambitious plans to grow the company and have been working on exciting new developments that will shape how our brand and products will look in the future. And this is where you fit in! 

We’re looking for a Frontend Software Engineer to join the team and help us create powerful and responsive web products. This role gives a unique opportunity to lead the continued development and expansion of our customer-facing content management web product as we improve the product and add numerous exciting and unique features. While the front-end will be the primary responsibility of this role, you will also be expected to understand the back-end and contribute at times. 

Being a part of a small, focused team, you will be working closely with our co-founding team including Yury, our Head of Engineering (based in Sofia Bulgaria), Michael, our Head of Product (based in NYC) as well as other co-founders and designer.

*Please no agencies or recruiters. Contact from agencies and recruiters will be ignored*

**Responsibilities**

• Develop user-facing content management dashboard
• Build reusable code components
• Follow designs to the pixel to create beautiful and usable dashboard
• Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
• Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability
• Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end

**Technical Stack / required skills**

• Angular 7+
• 2+ years web development experience
• Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS 2+
• Familiarity with Bootstrap 4
• Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and TypeScript/JavaScript frameworks
• Good understanding of Angular ecosystem, tools and libraries
• Fluency in English, including technical (software development) vocabulary

*Past experience building SaaS Dashboards / products is highly desired. Please include examples when you reach out!

We are open to remote employees but being based in Eastern Europe is preferred!

Salary and potential for equity TBD based on experience.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Vendible is a mobile payment and banking solution for our modern economy. We are helping to bridge traditional finance by leveraging new digital assets to speed settlement, reduce costs, secure data, and open access to millions of users who incur massive fees for operating outside of the banking system. We secure the financial and personal data of the merchants and consumers we serve using a decentralized credentialing and identification system. Our customers maintain full control of their data.

Vendible is building a blockchain-based, second-layer application which sits over existing mechanisms to drive the future of finance. We are interested in hiring experienced developers and engineers involved in shipping products that change the way people view and use money. Our ideal candidate has a proven track record in payments and banking and is ready for a new challenge in the emerging blockchain space.
 
Our engineering team uses these languages: Go, AngularJS, Java, TypeScript, JavaScript, node.js, Objective-C, C/C++, Python, and Solidity.

We are hiring for our Memphis office; however, remote positions are also available.

We love talking shop with people who spend their days working on:
- Blockchain: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Hyperledger, Decentralized Identifiers, ZKP, PoS, Hedera Hashgraph
-  Public/private key cryptography to generate and verify digital signatures
- Tokenization of real-world assets
- Asset management governed by smart contracts
- Developing applications for banking and other financial organizations
- Systems, mobile and web development in modern object-oriented programming languages
- Software development experience using Git, GitHub, Jira, and other project management tools
- Ability to write static libraries and frameworks for partners, commercial and open-source uses
- Writing technical documentation, flow diagrams, and other informational material
-  Ability to work with product and design teams to create rich and meaningful user experiences
- Experience writing and consuming RESTful APIs and SDKs
- Experience configuring and deploying web services to virtual machines using Docker containers
- Experience releasing applications to both Android and iOS application stores

Responsibilities
- Own the Vendible vision and express this by expanding the product line through the development of applications and software integrations to increase the value we deliver to our customers.
- Design and develop blockchain-based products that will enable banks and other business partners to integrate Vendible technology into their platforms and applications.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Software Engineering Interns will work on the Gitlab Product, like all engineers who work on the product. This may include both the open source version of GitLab, the enterprise editions, and the GitLab.com service. You will work in either a Frontend or Backend team on a mature stage product at Gitlab.

## Requirements

- Experience coding with Ruby on Rails or JavaScript framework (ideally Vue.js or other JS frameworks) either through university, personal projects or previous work experience.
- Proficiency in the English language, both written and verbal, sufficient for success in a remote and largely asynchronous work environment
- The ability to understand complex technical, architectural, and/or organizational problems
- Comfort working in a highly agile, intensely iterative software development process
- Positive and solution-oriented mindset
- Effective communication skills: Regularly achieve consensus with peers, and clear status updates
- An inclination towards communication, inclusion, and visibility
- Self-motivated and self-managing, with strong organizational skills, but with plenty of support from mentors, managers and internship managers throughout the programme
- Share our values, and work in accordance with those values
- Ability to thrive in a fully remote organization
- Computer Science Education or equivalent courses
- Contributor to open source projects

## Nice-to-haves

- Experience with the GitLab product as a user or contributor
- Completed foundation studies (1st year of college/university) in Computer Science or equivalent courses

## Responsibilities

- Develop features and improvements to the GitLab product in a secure, well-tested, and performant way
- Collaborate with Mentors and your Manager to maintain a high bar for quality in a fast-paced, iterative environment
- Advocate for improvements to product quality, security, and performance
- Solve technical problems of varying level of complexity
- Craft code that meets our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment.
- Confidently ship small features and improvements with guidance and support from mentors and managers.

## Hiring Process

Due to the high volume of applications, the bar is set very high and applications will be looked at extensively when making a decision to move a candidate forward.

1. Application
  1. Candidates are required to provide answers to:
    1. Technical Questions
    2. Situational Questions rather than STAR, as may not have any direct work/relatable experience.
    3. Cover Letter addressing 1-2 specific topics
2. Technical Assessment
  1. Automated online technical assessment
  2. Technical assessment interview
3. Behaviourial and Values based panel interview consisting of 3 panelists:
  - Hiring Manager
  - Recruiter/HR
  - Misc Interviewer
4. Decision is made and successful candidates will subsequently be made an offer. Additional details about our process can be found on our [hiring page](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/hiring)

highlightedJobListings.description:
Bison Trails is the leading blockchain infrastructure provider, and we are looking for an exceptional Blockchain Network Engineer to join our highly-skilled and passionate team in New York City. The ideal candidate is an experienced, motivated, self-starting engineer with a love for building containerized applications in a cloud native development environment.


We believe in the power of blockchain technology and building a decentralized future that enables greater participation in global financial networks. Our mission is to provide superior infrastructure on multiple blockchains, strengthen the entire ecosystem, and enable the pioneers of tomorrow.


What does it mean to be a Blockchain Network Engineer at Bison Trails? 


You have 3-5 years of infrastructure or full-stack engineering experience under your belt
You are a self-starter with a proven track record of shipping quality product
You are an autonomous worker with the ability to proactively manage the needs of a growing company with minimal oversight
You possess an analytical mindset and feel comfortable using qualitative and quantitative data to inform your decision making
You are proficient in a modern programming language such as Go, Python, or Rust
You are experienced in containerizing modern applications, particularly blockchain networks.
You have familiarity with Go and the Kubernetes ecosystem, but are not necessarily an expert
You take pride in having excellent written and verbal communication skills
You enjoy entrepreneurial environments and want to help build something meaningful
You preferably work in the greater NYC area, but if not, you are US-based with previous remote experience



Day to day, you will…


Work to support new and existing blockchain networks on our platform. This means dockerizing, YAML templating, and otherwise writing code that facilitates different networks running on our Kubernetes based platform every day
Research complex topics around specific blockchain networks including consensus algorithms, economic models, and node/network topology.
Interact and collaborate with other engineers and team members; we have a highly focused and collaborative team. Our team prioritizes creating a shared understanding of our systems/supported networks, and we are dedicated to supporting each other on a daily basis.
Contribute to blockchain network support discussions. We are looking for a strong technical leader that can help drive and own support for multiple networks.
Participate in the overall blockchain network community. Join third party discussions and become a contributor to the development of new and existing networks.
Build services and infrastructure that help to automate the deployment of blockchain network infrastructure
Incorporate monitoring, alerting, and observability to support blockchain networks that allow us to maintain the highest standards of health, reliability and uptime.
Write integration tests and contribute to maintaining a healthy CI/CD pipeline.
 

We are conveniently located in Tribeca, NYC. We provide competitive industry salaries along with:
Company-paid health, dental, vision, life & disability insurance
401(k) plan, FSA & commuter benefits
Flexible PTO
Training, mentorship, and coaching from industry leaders and company leadership
The opportunity to grow alongside a company that is helping create the decentralized future
Work in tandem with fun, diverse and open-minded colleagues
highlightedJobListings.title: Blockchain Network Engineer

highlightedJobListings.description:
Only applications submitted via https://jobs.lever.co/roger/2346bedd-138d-4755-b73e-6c64903c4b0c will be considered

Remote candidates encouraged - we have a remote-first culture. 

About Us

Roger was founded to make day-to-day financial operations like bill pay, expense management, compliance and bookkeeping as worry-free as possible for business owners, finance teams, accountants and bookkeepers. Roger works as an automated layer on top of a company's accounting software, saving businesses and accountants hours of work every day. We're proud of the product that we've built so far, and our 1,000+ global customers base agree that we're making something complex and tedious simple and maybe even fun. 

We are backed by some of the best investors in the financial technology and just raised $7.3m. We have huge ambitions for our growth in 2019. But we are still a small team and therefore we want you to be part of the journey.
Joining Roger will be chance to join a fast-paced company, with a global product. We hire for attitude and not credentials. Please apply regardless of your current position background, or experience.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Engineer to run our integration efforts with our services. Our product integrates with a number of different services, such as accounting platforms like QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, as well as collaboration tools like Slack, Box and Dropbox. Allowing our customers to set up custom workflows that fit their exact needs is a core part of our product experience. We have an existing integration framework and a robust API in place, but we are looking to add a new team member to own the integration work end-to-end. This includes building new, as well as maintaining and improving the existing ones - all to ensure a stellar user experience.

You'll be working collaboratively with the rest of the engineering team as well as with the product team to drive the implementation and release of new integrations. You'll be familiar with all parts of our stack from end to end, and will drive positive change to Roger's engineering culture, processes and technology.

We see this role as a unique chance to own an important piece of the Roger product, see it grow, and flourish very quickly. 

Your profile

- Excited to work on building the foundations of Roger's integrations ecosystem
- Comfortable working with external partners and managing your projects from A-Z
- Experience in working with object-oriented programming
- Comfortable working with .NET and C#
- Experience working with relational\non-relational, Aurora\MySql and Dynamodb
- Experience with REST APIs

The Team

The engineering team is characterized by a high degree of support internally. We help each other out and pitch in when problems arise as well as give each other feedback to grow. Our top priority is to build the world's best financial automation platforms, while keeping our users safe and compliant. Scalability, reliability and robustness are keywords we live by but we also get excited about building out feature MVPs quickly to keep our innovative reputation with customers and partners alive and well at all times.   

The Stack

Roger's backend is built on .NET with C#. We love the simplicity, speed and structure of C#, combined with the built-in security and robustness it offers developers. On the front-end we work in React and React Native, enabling us to build reliable web experiences that can handle high usage volumes. 

Additionally, we make extensive use of Lamda (integrations only), AWS, Git, Bugsnag, Heroku and other great tools to keep our development processes running smoothly. 

Our Values

We're a global company with offices in Copenhagen and San Francisco. Our values are heavily influenced by our Scandinavian roots (both founders are from Denmark), and count humility, humor and inclusiveness. We strive to create a culture where anyone feels part of the family, and we place a great amount of value in hiring for attitude rather than resumes. We support flexibility in everyone's lives, and working at Roger can be easily combined with babies, toddlers and teenagers. We have two primary office locations but have a remote culture that we put a lot of effort into as we believe great talent can be found anywhere. As a remote worker you can be sure to feel like you are as much part of the team as those who come to an office every day. About every 6 months we all get together in person. Our last trips took us to Greece and Spain. Everyone on the team shares a passion for creating the best possible product and user experience, and that is something we value in future team members as well. 

The Roger Story

Roger's founders started the company after exiting their first startup to Cisco Systems. Having experienced all the frustrations with daily financial operations when starting previous ventures, the first gist of an idea for Roger was born in 2016. Since then, international investors from both Europe and the US have supported the growth of the team and the customer base, and the product is now used and loved by more than 1,000 customers worldwide. 

Roger is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

You are an autonomous worker with the ability to proactively manage the needs of a growing company with minimal oversight
You possess an analytical mindset and feel comfortable using qualitative and quantitative data to inform your decision making
You are proficient in a modern programming language such as Go, Python, or Rust
You are experienced in containerizing modern applications, particularly blockchain networks.
You have familiarity with Go and the Kubernetes ecosystem, but are not necessarily an expert
You take pride in having excellent written and verbal communication skills
You enjoy entrepreneurial environments and want to help build something meaningful
You preferably work in the greater NYC area, but if not, you are US-based with previous remote experience



Day to day, you will…


Work to support new and existing blockchain networks on our platform. This means dockerizing, YAML templating, and otherwise writing code that facilitates different networks running on our Kubernetes based platform every day
Research complex topics around specific blockchain networks including consensus algorithms, economic models, and node/network topology.
Interact and collaborate with other engineers and team members; we have a highly focused and collaborative team. Our team prioritizes creating a shared understanding of our systems/supported networks, and we are dedicated to supporting each other on a daily basis.
Contribute to blockchain network support discussions. We are looking for a strong technical leader that can help drive and own support for multiple networks.
Participate in the overall blockchain network community. Join third party discussions and become a contributor to the development of new and existing networks.
Build services and infrastructure that help to automate the deployment of blockchain network infrastructure
Incorporate monitoring, alerting, and observability to support blockchain networks that allow us to maintain the highest standards of health, reliability and uptime.
Write integration tests and contribute to maintaining a healthy CI/CD pipeline.
 

We are conveniently located in Tribeca, NYC. We provide competitive industry salaries along with:
Company-paid health, dental, vision, life & disability insurance
401(k) plan, FSA & commuter benefits
Flexible PTO
Training, mentorship, and coaching from industry leaders and company leadership
The opportunity to grow alongside a company that is helping create the decentralized future
Work in tandem with fun, diverse and open-minded colleagues

highlightedJobListings.description:
Are you tired of boring fintech apps? Are you interested in cryptocurrency? Do you want to learn more about the role it plays in the new economy and how to leverage that to your advantage? Apollo is creating the future of crypto trading and spearheading cryptoasset adoption by taking a user-first approach. We want to create a delightful user experience and a performant platform that makes users come back for more! We welcome passionate, intellectually curious and dedicated people looking to join our remote team. Check us out at www.apollodae.io.

Apollo interns will have the opportunity to advance their skills by making meaningful contributions to product development. Yes, that means your work will be shipped off to production! Aside from this, you will have the opportunity to learn how to trade from veteran traders and even create your own bots.

You’re an enthusiastic student or recent graduate with an interest in back end development. We care more about your desire to learn than your credentials. As an intern, you will support the development team in connecting various APIs, libraries, and creating modules in NodeJS.

These are some of your personality traits:  
Reliable and an effective communicator
A strong commitment to quality and deadlines
Motivated by collaboration and love working on a team
Humble and hungry to learn skills within and beyond your domain
Desire for constant self-improvement and excellence
Keen attention to detail

Your expertise comprises the following:
JavaScript application design and testing
Creating Node.js applications
Designing and implementing webhooks and APIs (REST, SOAP, etc.)
JSON, REST, Firebase, Parse, PHP, and the like
Managing back end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users
Asynchronous I/O and NoSQL datastores such as MongoDB
MVC architecture
Unit testing and automation
 
Bonus points for:
Knowledge of Websockets: deepstream.io, sockjs, socket.io etc.
Experience with golang
Experience with front-end development frameworks like VueJS
Experience working with time-series data (stock market data etc.)

On the job you will:	
Write well designed, testable, and efficient code. 
Design, code, and build architecture based on new foundation principles established by the team.
Integrate various APIs, libraries and create modules as needed.
Debug issues and address performance bottlenecks.
Coordinate with product managers to meet functional requirements.
Use time tracking and management tools, such as Toggl and Trello.

We are looking for interns who can start ASAP! Remember, even if you don’t have all of the skills listed above, but are very interested in learning, we’d still love to talk to you! To apply, submit the following information to internships@apollodae.io:
Updated LinkedIn profile link (don’t sweat this!) 
What are you studying (or have studied)? (eg. BS Computer Science)
Sample code or repo, if available 
Date you can start working
How long you have been working with Node.js
Details of experience with technologies listed above
Number of hours per week you can fully commit to
Something quirky/interesting about yourself

-----

Upon conclusion of the internship, which shall last no longer than six (6) months or one (1) semester,  but only for those interns with exemplary performance and work ethic may be granted an opportunity to interview with Apollo DAE for a paid position within the company if the company has the proper funding allocations for that department.
 
Intern understands, acknowledges, and agrees that there will be no compensation for this position.

Intern will be provided a letter of recommendation that is accurate to their position, work ethic, and performance with Apollo DAE. Intern may apply for college credit and Apollo DAE will work with interns applicable school to aid in this objective.

highlightedJobListings.description:
At LogDNA, a leading intuitive cloud services-based server log management system, we strive to help developers pinpoint production issues by aggregating all system and application logs into one platform. With a customer base of highly reputable companies and thousands of engineers that ingest billions of events and terabytes of data every day to identify and diagnose production issues, we can ensure our customers are our top priority.

We’re currently looking for a driven Technical Sales Engineer to evangelize and problem solve with our largest clients. Our team is highly motivated, enthusiastic and focused on helping the developer community remove obstacles in order to focus on evolving their own products. Our ideal new teammate will both welcome change and develop structure for our business, as LogDNA continues to mature. Submit your resume if you’re excited to make an impact at an agile, venture-backed company in a quickly-progressing environment.

**What to expect in the role**

- Effectively map existing pain points to LogDNA’s solutions and value
- Execute technical discovery and help qualify customer goals in order to relay solutions that resonate with specific customer use cases
- Collaborate with Sales team throughout customer experience, providing technical expertise to help customers realize value of leveraging LogDNA
- Drive successful demos and Proof of Concepts (POCs) by understanding customer pain points, goals, success criteria, and aligning with a technical plan for success 
- Impact product roadmap by identifying customer needs and feedback, advocating on their behalf with Engineering and Product teams
- Represent LogDNA company and culture as you present, demo and speak at industry conferences, shows and other events
- Evangelize product features, use cases and ecosystem impact to a wide range of audiences, including Developers, Ops, Product leaders/owners, and more
- Continuously drive improvements in product demo experience

**To excel in this position, you must have:**

- A desire to identify problems and bring solutions
- Strong technical proficiency and experience in mobile or web development, device platforms & architectures, high availability systems, or pipeline design 
- 4+ years experience in a sales-centric role such as sales / solutions architect, solutions engineering or early stage engineering
- Familiarity with Kubernetes environment and how logging fits into the developer ecosystem
- Development experience in C/C++, Go, Java, Javacsript, Node, Python, or Ruby
- Excellent communication and presentation skills, particularly when evangelizing your product value
- Passion for collaborating cross-functionally to solve business and technical problems
- Ability to travel 25% - 50% of the work month

**Nice to have, but not required:**

- Experience processing loglines and/or experience using LogDNA
- Understanding of the log management ecosystem and competitors
- Specific product development or management experience
- SQL development, data warehousing and data modeling experience

**Benefits**

- Working in a fun, energetic, agile team environment
- Free snacks, lunch, drinks, and coffee
- Lots of exciting new projects
- Competitive compensation plan
- Competitive advantages

  - 100% Full health premium coverage for you and your dependents (yes... everyone)
  - Dental and Vision coverage
  - Unlimited Vacation 

This is a full-time remote opportunity in the US. Apply with confidence - fortune favors the bold.
highlightedJobListings.title: Technical Sales Engineer

highlightedJobListings.description:
At LogDNA you’ll help us build a fast and modern log management platform that offers the flexibility of an amazing developer experience with the trust of enterprise-grade infrastructure. Today, LogDNA is used by over 3,000 teams including IBM, OpenAI, Instacart, and Lime Bike. We’re building a future where developers don’t have to dread the tools they use at work, starting with log management. We've achieved 300% year-over-year revenue growth in the last year, and we're just getting started.

We're Y-Combinator alumni, venture-backed by Emergence Capital (Salesforce, Box, and Zoom) and Initialized Capital (Reddit, Coinbase, and Patreon). Our team comes from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences, having worked on products at Heroku, Facebook, WhatsApp, Udacity, Ripple, among others.

At LogDNA, we strive to help developers pinpoint production issues by aggregating all system and application logs into one platform. With a customer base of highly reputable companies and thousands of engineers that ingest billions of events and terabytes of data every day to identify and diagnose production issues, we can ensure our customers are our top priority.

We currently are looking for a passionate Cloud engineer who is a motivated and an influential addition to the team to take part in our continued success and growth. The successful candidate will also be an energetic self-starter with a passion about engaging our customers and ensuring that they have a great experience. He/she will be results-driven, ambitious and enthusiastic about making an impact with an agile, venture-backed, Y Combinator alum start-up.

**Responsibilities**

- Responsible for providing amazing customer service and technical support on a rotating schedule with your team
- Working directly with Ops & Engineering for high priority, on-call situations
- Taking ownership of customer issues, managing customer expectations, and seeing those customer issues through to resolution
- Developing a deep understanding of the LogDNA platform and how our customers use it on a day to day basis
- Provisioning & maintaining testing environments for the support organization
- Writing & maintaining awesome documentation as well as developing playbooks and run books
- Performing change management tasks on live production environments
- Work very closely with our engineering, operations and product teams to discover, triage, and solve complex, technical problems

**Qualifications:**

- 5+ years of experience either in systems engineering, system administration, DevOps, Site Reliability or other highly technical customer engaging role preferred
- Strong systems background in Linux, such as Red Hat Enterprise Linux, CentOS and/or Ubuntu
- AWS/Google Cloud Platform/Azure/IBM Cloud experience is required (one or more)
- Containerized deployment knowledge is required
- Basic knowledge of distributed systems is required
- Experience with incident management is preferred but not required
- Deep understanding and ability to troubleshoot distributed systems at scale
- Strong aptitude for doing deep technical and root cause testing and analysis
- Expert at generating awesome technical documentation
- You love solving problems and creating brilliant solutions that have immediate impact on the company
- Basic programming or scripting knowledge is a must
- Strong written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to interact with both internal teams and 3rd parties
- Outstanding analytical and organizational skills
- Ability to remain calm, composed and articulate when dealing with difficult customer situations
- Love working in a fast paced startup environment with team-oriented goals
- Self-starter with a "Get stuff done" attitude and an appetite for learning

**Bonus:**

- Experience with logging application a plus
- Experience with Kubernetes is a plus

**Benefits:**

- Working in a fun, energetic, agile team environment
- Free snacks, lunch, drinks, and coffee
- Lots of exciting new projects
- Competitive compensation plan
- Competitive benefits
  - 100% Full health premium coverage for you and your dependents (yes... everyone)

  - Unlimited Vacation

This is a full-time opportunity based remotely supporting EU geographies. Apply with confidence - fortune favors the bold.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Flowplayer is now looking for an experienced JavaScript developer with a passion for quality code to further enhance our video player.

What you will do -

Develop the core functionality of our HTML5 video player
Tune the performance of the core player based on real usage metrics
Work with some of the most forward-thinking video publishers in the world to improve the player
Extend the core player functionality with plugins such as subtitles, analytics and more
Help us to grow the ecosystem by giving support to the community developing plugins around the core player

We’d love it if you - 
Are a seasoned developer fluent in JavaScript
Know your way around browser quirks and compatibility issues
Are comfortable working with vanilla JavaScript and DOM
Value quality code and continuously collaborate with the rest of the team helping each other out to always find the simplest and most elegant solution to any given problem
Are willing to leave your ego at the door and are open to learning from those around you, but you are also comfortable vigorously debating the right approach to solving problems
Value an engineering culture rooted in collaboration, humility, trust, responsibility, and learning
Fluent in the English language (both written and spoken)
Bonus points
Knowledge of video technologies
Experience working in open source projects and communities

What we offer - 

Flowplayer Native is the latest incarnation of our player. It’s written from the ground up to be a native HTML5 player without any fallbacks. It’s the smallest and most performant player in the market. We are proud of the quality of the codebase and continuously evolve our development practices to help us in our mission to keep the quality of the product top notch.

As part of the developer team, you get to work with passionate developers that are ready to help you out when facing challenges. The new video player carries no legacy burden and as such, you can help influence the future of one of the most used web technologies today with an estimated 1 million installs on the web and more than 1 billion people watching videos every month.

Location

We are a remote-first team so you get to choose where you work from
Offices in the US (New York, Washington), UK (London), Finland (Helsinki, Turku) and Sweden (Stockholm)

About Flowplayer

Flowplayer is one of the most used video technologies on the web with approximately 1 million sites using the player and/or platform and estimated more than a billion people seeing video through Flowplayer every month.

We are passionate about building great products and thrive on solving difficult problems as a team.

We offer the ability to work either in our offices (US, UK, Finland, Sweden, Germany, Portugal) or remotely.

Flowplayer is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
highlightedJobListings.title: Senior JavaScript Developer

Passion to improve video advertising revenues for our customers
Strategic technology mindset with a strong ability to implement a strategy
You are willing to leave your ego at the door and are open to learning from those around you, but you are also comfortable vigorously debating the right approach to solving problems
You value an engineering culture rooted in collaboration, humility, trust, responsibility, and learning
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Location -

We offer the possibility to either work from one of our current offices, set up a new one, or work remotely. Today approximately 50% of our employees work remotely
Offices in the US (New York, Washington), UK (London), Finland (Helsinki, Turku) and Sweden (Stockholm)

About Flowplayer -

Flowplayer is one of the most used video technologies on the web with approximately 1 million sites using the player and/or platform and estimated more than a billion people seeing video through Flowplayer every month.
We are passionate about building great products and thrive on solving difficult problems as a team.

We offer the ability to work either in our offices (US, UK, Finland, Sweden, Germany, Portugal) or remotely.
Flowplayer is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

highlightedJobListings.description:
We are expanding our sales organisation to support our global sales team with a Solutions Engineer or Pre-sales manager for Video products. 

You will be responsible for providing great demos and technical support to customers and prospects working closely together with the sales team as well as the product, support and engineering teams.

We believe that you could be a technical person with a passion for customers and sales or someone with a technical background who want to explore a career in sales. This is a great opportunity for a technical person to thrive in a sales environment as many customers are very technical and your knowledge would be a key differentiator in the sales discussion.


What you will do

Respond to initial technical and product requests from our global customer base
Translate technical features into value drivers for customers
Together with sales reps plan and deliver demos to customers
Follow up on questions and outstanding issues from initial demos and calls and drive the process towards closing the technical sales process
Drive test and pilot implementations together with tech team
Overall responsible for coordinating the technical part of our answers to RFP’s
Act as a technical account manager for strategic accounts to ensure customers benefits of using our solutions
Develop and maintain training materials, and deliver training to improve technical abilities of inside and enterprise salespeople
Work collaboratively with product management, marketing and engineering during the development, launch and continuing refinement of existing and new Flowplayer products
Travel internationally for on-site demos and presentations with large Enterprise prospects
Become an expert in Flowplayer products and solutions

We’d love it if you have

At least 3 years of prior Sales/Systems Engineering or Solution Architect experience with video software in a SaaS/Cloud environment.
Solid knowledge of video technology in a SaaS/cloud environment and web technologies like HTML5, JavaScript and CSS
Strong customer facing and relationship building skills
Structured approach and a team attitude
Knowledge of the Ad-tech or video streaming sphere. 
Graduate or Undergraduate degree in quantitative or technical degree (E.g. Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another quantitative field. Strong academic performance)
Excellent communication skills in English

Location

During the first 3-6 months you need to spend some time with our technical team in Stockholm, Sweden, to secure easy access to the extensive knowledge of our solution and the video area in general. Our recommendation is that you at least initially is based at our office in central Stockholm or travel there regularly.

The Presales Manager will be part of the Global Revenue team and report to the VP Sales, Robert Bohlin, +46 704 96 40 96 or email robert.bohlin@flowplayer.com.


About Flowplayer

Flowplayer is one of the most used video technologies on the web with approximately 1 million sites using the player and/or platform and estimated more than a billion people seeing video through Flowplayer every month.

We are passionate about building great products and thrive on solving difficult problems as a team.

We offer the ability to work either in our offices (US, UK, Finland, Sweden, Germany, Portugal) or remotely.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Only applications submitted via https://jobs.lever.co/roger/2346bedd-138d-4755-b73e-6c64903c4b0c will be considered

Remote candidates encouraged - we have a remote-first culture. 

About Us

Roger was founded to make day-to-day financial operations like bill pay, expense management, compliance and bookkeeping as worry-free as possible for business owners, finance teams, accountants and bookkeepers. Roger works as an automated layer on top of a company's accounting software, saving businesses and accountants hours of work every day. We're proud of the product that we've built so far, and our 1,000+ global customers base agree that we're making something complex and tedious simple and maybe even fun. 

We are backed by some of the best investors in the financial technology and just raised $7.3m. We have huge ambitions for our growth in 2019. But we are still a small team and therefore we want you to be part of the journey.
Joining Roger will be chance to join a fast-paced company, with a global product. We hire for attitude and not credentials. Please apply regardless of your current position background, or experience.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Software Engineer to run our integration efforts with our services. Our product integrates with a number of different services, such as accounting platforms like QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, as well as collaboration tools like Slack, Box and Dropbox. Allowing our customers to set up custom workflows that fit their exact needs is a core part of our product experience. We have an existing integration framework and a robust API in place, but we are looking to add a new team member to own the integration work end-to-end. This includes building new, as well as maintaining and improving the existing ones - all to ensure a stellar user experience.

You'll be working collaboratively with the rest of the engineering team as well as with the product team to drive the implementation and release of new integrations. You'll be familiar with all parts of our stack from end to end, and will drive positive change to Roger's engineering culture, processes and technology.

We see this role as a unique chance to own an important piece of the Roger product, see it grow, and flourish very quickly. 

Your profile

- Excited to work on building the foundations of Roger's integrations ecosystem
- Comfortable working with external partners and managing your projects from A-Z
- Experience in working with object-oriented programming
- Comfortable working with .NET and C#
- Experience working with relational\non-relational, Aurora\MySql and Dynamodb
- Experience with REST APIs

The Team

The engineering team is characterized by a high degree of support internally. We help each other out and pitch in when problems arise as well as give each other feedback to grow. Our top priority is to build the world's best financial automation platforms, while keeping our users safe and compliant. Scalability, reliability and robustness are keywords we live by but we also get excited about building out feature MVPs quickly to keep our innovative reputation with customers and partners alive and well at all times.   

The Stack

Roger's backend is built on .NET with C#. We love the simplicity, speed and structure of C#, combined with the built-in security and robustness it offers developers. On the front-end we work in React and React Native, enabling us to build reliable web experiences that can handle high usage volumes. 

Additionally, we make extensive use of Lamda (integrations only), AWS, Git, Bugsnag, Heroku and other great tools to keep our development processes running smoothly. 

Our Values

We're a global company with offices in Copenhagen and San Francisco. Our values are heavily influenced by our Scandinavian roots (both founders are from Denmark), and count humility, humor and inclusiveness. We strive to create a culture where anyone feels part of the family, and we place a great amount of value in hiring for attitude rather than resumes. We support flexibility in everyone's lives, and working at Roger can be easily combined with babies, toddlers and teenagers. We have two primary office locations but have a remote culture that we put a lot of effort into as we believe great talent can be found anywhere. As a remote worker you can be sure to feel like you are as much part of the team as those who come to an office every day. About every 6 months we all get together in person. Our last trips took us to Greece and Spain. Everyone on the team shares a passion for creating the best possible product and user experience, and that is something we value in future team members as well. 

The Roger Story

Roger's founders started the company after exiting their first startup to Cisco Systems. Having experienced all the frustrations with daily financial operations when starting previous ventures, the first gist of an idea for Roger was born in 2016. Since then, international investors from both Europe and the US have supported the growth of the team and the customer base, and the product is now used and loved by more than 1,000 customers worldwide. 

Roger is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to maintain and develop our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Klaviyo is growing fast and we have openings for all skill levels across all of our teams. Learn more about our engineering culture at https://klaviyo.tech

We love tackling tough engineering problems and look for Engineers who specialize in certain areas but are passionate about building, owning & scaling features end to end from scratch and breaking through any obstacle or technical challenge in their way. We push each other to move out of our comfort zone, learn new technologies and work hard to ensure each day is better than the last. 

Senior Engineers demonstrate adaptability by continuing to acquire and master new skills, level up all those around them, and research and prototype new technologies and solutions to help scale Klaviyo’s systems and product capabilities. Klaviyo operates a real-time data platform coded in Python built for massive scale on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Engineers come to Klaviyo with experience in a variety of languages and from a number of disciplines. All engineers are expected to become extremely proficient in the technologies we use (not exhaustive):

Python, Django, Java, Celery
MySQL, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Redis
HTML, JavaScript, LESS, Backbone.js, React
Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, Aurora, etc.)
Terraform, Ansible, Packer, and other DevOps tools


How you will make a difference:
- Have the chance to wholly own features that thousands of our customers rely on daily to reach 100,000,000+ of consumers to drive their business forward.
- Work on crafting our highly scalable real-time data pipeline that processes billions of events weekly across data sets growing to petabyte scale.
- Work on deep analytics system that provides insight into hundreds of terabytes of data.
- Be empowered to own the mission, technical direction and operations of projects that have immediate impact.
- Help architect and design robust and high performance data processing and storage systems leveraging new databases to serve different internal and external use cases. Contribute to open source data processing technologies.
- Contribute to the company as a subject matter expert in multiple areas, constantly pushing yourself to be a better engineer and to level up all of your peers within your team and within Klaviyo.


Who You Are:
- Have experience building products that matter and pushing yourself and your team to be better engineers and build a product with passionate advocates.
- Enjoy working with system software ranging from traditional databases to new data processing frameworks, and are particularly passionate and an expert in multiple stack areas. You show this by having strong and opinionated experience with various technologies and know how to pick the right tool for any job. 
- Love digging into performance and scalability issues to drive breakthrough solutions.
- Familiar with concurrent programming and have experience building distributed systems[.](http://systems.Enjoy)
- Enjoy shipping code early & often in an agile fashion, pairing with product management to craft better software by soliciting feedback from thousands of end users.
- Like working on a small, autonomous agile teams. At Klaviyo, you will have ownership of features, but you'll collaborate with everyone to make sure we produce the right solution.


Get to know Klaviyo

Klaviyo is the world’s leading owned marketing platform known for accelerating revenue for online businesses using the channels they own like email, web, and mobile. Enabling companies to leverage these owned marketing channels, Klaviyo makes it easy to store, access, analyze and use transactional and behavioral data to power highly-targeted customer and prospect communications. And unlike other marketing platforms, Klaviyo doesn’t force companies to compromise between advanced functionality or ease of use - so companies of all sizes are able to maximize their sales quickly. That’s why over 28,000+ innovative companies like Unilever, Custom Ink and Eventbrite sell more with Klaviyo.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Postman is the world’s leading collaboration platform for API development. Postman's features simplify each step of building an API and streamline collaboration to help create better APIs—faster. More than 8 million developers and 400,000 organizations worldwide use Postman today.

Our customers are doing more and more astounding things with the Postman product every day, and as a result, we are growing rapidly.

In this role, you'll work closely and collaboratively within the Developer Relations team to drive API better practices throughout the broader API ecosystem. In addition to advocacy, you will also have shared responsibilities for user education and community engagement.

Strong preference will be given to candidates based in NYC and other major tech centers on the US east coast.

Responsibilities

* Engage with various kinds of Postman users (including developers, testers, architects, and more) to understand their perspectives, workflows, and use cases.
* Drive API better practices by creating blog and video content, developing code samples and open source tools, and/or speaking at events
* Assist with Postman documentation, tutorials, and other education efforts within DevRel
* Assist with Postman forum management, events, and other community engagement within DevRel
* Build and nurture relationships with Postman champions and other community leaders
* Dogfood Postman technology, and interpret user data and community feedback, to drive insights and assist product development
* Represent the company online and at events

Requirements

* Strong familiarity and knowledge of Postman and its products
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills with the proven ability to communicate effectively at all levels internally and externally and across diverse geographies and leveraging remote teaming technologies
* Demonstrated experience working with developer communities and APIs
* Two years of programming experience, or a willingness and aptitude for learning technology
* Experience making data-driven decisions.
* Able to work long hours and weekends when needed
* Able to travel, including international

Benefits

We offer a competitive salary, equity participation and excellent benefits. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in autonomous small teams for maximum impact; that strives for organizational growth to align with that of the individual; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves and where ideas are encouraged from anyone and everyone. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who not only understand the challenge but can also solve this for the rest of the world. Be a part of something big.

highlightedJobListings.description:
Loom.ai is a venture-backed tech company headquartered in San Francisco, CA. Loom.ai enables a new era of virtual communication by automatically converting selfies into expressive 3D avatars. The core technology leverages Loom.ai’s deep expertise in computer vision and machine learning combined with VFX magic to create life-like human face visualizations. The animatable and expressive faces can be used to power applications in messaging, live streaming, AR, VR, gaming, e-commerce and virtual classrooms for individuals and businesses around the world. Loom's API is currently in private beta and is being actively integrated into mobile platforms with millions of users. Our current team comprises multiple PhDs, has decades of experience writing industry-strength software for VFX/games/ML and Computer Vision, a keen eye for scaling/infrastructure, very strong research creds (papers in SIGGRAPH/SCA/CVPR), and three Sci-Tech Oscars. You have an opportunity to join us at a pre-series A stage and have a direct impact on shipping applications with millions of users.

Requirements: 

- Experience applying deep learning to computer vision problems
- Knowledge of convolutional networks and common architectures (Inception, ResNet, DenseNet, etc)
- Proficiency with at least one deep learning library (TensorFlow, Torch, MXNet, etc)
- Familiarity with traditional computer vision in C++ with libraries such as OpenCV
- Solid software design skills and ability to write organized, efficient, readable and reusable research code
- Strong communication and collaboration skills
- MS/PhD in a related field with an emphasis on computer vision or machine learning, or BS with equivalent industry experience

Plus: 

​- Experience deploying machine learning models in production environments
- Familiarity with distributed computing frameworks such as Hadoop or Spark, or distributed training of deep learning models
- Knowledge of algorithms applied to faces such as face recognition, landmarking, or reconstruction, or advanced deep learning topics
- Knowledge of algorithms for facial animation synthesis from audio, video and other signals
- Publications in machine learning or computer vision conferences (CVPR, ICCV, ICML, NIPS, etc)
- Ability and enthusiasm to learn new technologies quickly
highlightedJobListings.title: Deep Learning Research Engineer

highlightedJobListings.description:
Loom.ai is enabling a new era of virtual communication through the creation, animation and sharing of personalized, 3D avatars. Headquartered in San Francisco, and an alumni of the Y Combinator Fellowship, the Academy Award-winning team has created a best-in-class solution powered by deep learning, computer vision and visual effects. Loom.ai recently announced its partnership with Samsung which brings its fully embedded SDK solution to power ‘AR Emoji’ on the brand-new Samsung Galaxy S9 and S9+ devices.

In just seconds, Loom.ai can take a single photograph and transform it into a fully representative, 3D avatar as personalized as the individual by recognizing the many nuances that make each face unique. Animatable and expressive in real-time, these avatars can be used to power current and future applications in mobile messaging, entertainment, AR/VR, e-commerce, video conferencing, broadcasting and more.

Our current team comprises multiple PhDs, has decades of experience writing industry-strength software for VFX/games along with a keen eye for scaling/infrastructure, very strong research creds (papers in SIGGRAPH/SCA/CVPR), and three Sci-Tech Oscars. You have an opportunity to join us at a pre-series A stage and have a direct impact on shipping computer vision applications on tens of millions of mobile phones worldwide.
​
Requirements: 

- Experience writing real-time, advanced 2D/3D computer vision software. Examples include algorithms for facial landmark tracking, body pose estimation, structure from motion, optical flow and texture synthesis.
- Experience with machine learning techniques for classification and regression applied to images or video.
- Strong C++ skills (preferably C++ 11/14) and object oriented design.
- Ability to write organized, efficient, readable and reusable code.
- Solid foundations in math, algorithms, data structures, and numerical optimization.
- B.S/ B.E / MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related.
- 5+ years of software development experience in a commercial environment. 

Plus: 

​- OSX, iOS, and Android development experience.
- Experience with Python.
- Strong communication and collaboration skills.
- Proven ability to lead feature development from concept definition to shipping product.
